17656.text: ¶This is the vision which Isaiah, son of Amoz, saw about Judah and Jerusalem at the time of Kings Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah.

17657.text: §¶Listen, heaven, and pay attention, earth!/_Yahweh has spoken,/_“I raised my children and helped them grow,/_but they have rebelled against me.

17658.text: /Oxen know their owners,/_and donkeys know where their masters feed them./_But Israel doesn’t know its owner./_My people don’t understand who feeds them.

17659.text: ¶“How horrible it will be for a nation that sins./_Its people are loaded down with guilt./_They are descendants of evildoers/_and destructive children./_They have abandoned Yahweh./_They have despised Qedosh Yisrael./_They have turned their backs on him.

17660.text: ¶“Why do you still want to be beaten?/_Why do you continue to rebel?/_Your whole head is infected./_Your whole heart is failing.

17661.text: /From the bottom of your feet to the top of your head/_there is no healthy spot left on your body—/_only bruises, sores, and fresh wounds./_They haven’t been cleansed, bandaged,/_or soothed with oil.

17662.text: ¶“Your country is devastated./_Your cities are burned down./_Your fields are destroyed right before your eyes by foreigners./_Your fields are devastated and taken over by foreigners.

17663.text: /My people Zion are left like a hut in a vineyard,/_like a shack in a cucumber field,/_like a city under attack.”

17664.text: ¶If Yahweh Tsebaoth hadn’t left us a few survivors,/_we would have been like Sodom and Gomorrah.

17665.text: §¶Listen to the word of Yahweh, you rulers of Sodom!/_Pay attention to the teachings from our Elohim, you people of Gomorrah!

17666.text: /Yahweh asks, “What do your many animal sacrifices mean to me?/_I’ve had enough of your burnt offerings of rams/_and enough fat from your fattened calves./_I’m not pleased with the blood of bulls, lambs, or male goats.

17667.text: /When you appear in my presence,/_who asked you to trample on my courtyards?

17668.text: /Don’t bring any more worthless grain offerings./_Your incense is disgusting to me,/_so are your New Moon Festivals, your days of worship,/_and the assemblies you call./_I can’t stand your evil assemblies.

17669.text: /I hate your New Moon Festivals and your appointed festivals./_They’ve become a burden to me,/_and I’m tired of putting up with them.

17670.text: /So when you stretch out your hands in prayer,/_I will turn my eyes away from you./_Even though you offer many prayers,/_I will not listen because your hands are covered with blood.

17671.text: §¶“Wash yourselves! Become clean!/_Get your evil deeds out of my sight./_Stop doing evil.

17672.text: /Learn to do good./_Seek justice./_Arrest oppressors./_Defend orphans./_Plead the case of widows.”

17673.text: ¶“Come on now, let’s discuss this!” says Yahweh./_“Though your sins are bright red,/_they will become as white as snow./_Though they are dark red,/_they will become as white as wool.

17674.text: /If you are willing and obedient,/_you will eat the best from the land.

17675.text: /But if you refuse and rebel,/_you will be destroyed by swords.”/_Yahweh has spoken.

17676.text: §¶How the faithful town has become a prostitute!/_She was full of justice,/_and righteousness lived in her./_But now murderers live there!

17677.text: /Your silver is not pure./_Your wine is watered down.

17678.text: /Your rulers are rebels, friends with thieves./_They all love bribes and run after gifts./_They never defend orphans./_They don’t notice the widows’ pleas.

17679.text: ¶That’s why Adonay, Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Mighty One of Israel, says,¶▼“How horrible it will be when I take revenge on my opponents!/_I will avenge myself against my enemies.

17680.text: /I will turn my power against you./_I will remove your impurities with bleach./_I will get rid of all your impurities.

17681.text: /I will give you judges like you had long ago,/_advisers like you had in the beginning./_After that you will be called the Righteous City,/_the Faithful Town.”

17682.text: ¶Zion will be pardoned by the Lord’s justice,/_and those who return will be pardoned/_by the Lord’s righteousness.

17683.text: /Rebels and sinners will be crushed at the same time,/_and those who abandon Yahweh will come to an end.

17684.text: /You will be ashamed of the oaks that you wanted to worship/_and embarrassed by the garden that you have chosen for your gods.

17685.text: /You will be like an oak whose leaves wither/_and like a garden without water.

17686.text: /Strong people will become tinder for a fire,/_and their work will be the spark./_Both of them will burn together,/_and there will be no one to put out the fire.

17687.text: §¶This is the message which Isaiah, son of Amoz, saw about Judah and Jerusalem.

17688.text: ¶In the last days the mountain of Yahweh’s house/_will be established as the highest of the mountains/_and raised above the hills./_All the nations will stream to it.

17689.text: /Then many people will come and say,/_“Let’s go to the mountain of Yahweh,/_to the house of the Elohim of Jacob./_He will teach us his ways so that we may live by them.”/_The teachings will go out from Zion./_The word of Yahweh will go out from Jerusalem.

17690.text: /Then he will judge disputes between nations/_and settle arguments between many people./_They will hammer their swords into plowblades/_and their spears into pruning shears./_Nations will never fight against each other,/_and they will never train for war again.

17691.text: /Come, descendants of Jacob,/_let’s live in the light of Yahweh.

17692.text: §¶Yahweh, you have abandoned your people, the descendants of Jacob,/_because they are filled with Eastern influences./_They are fortunetellers like the Philistines,/_and they make deals with foreigners.

17693.text: /Their land is filled with silver and gold,/_and there is no end to their treasures./_Their land is filled with horses,/_and there is no end to their chariots.

17694.text: /Their land is filled with idols,/_and they worship what their hands have shaped/_and what their fingers have molded.

17695.text: /People will be brought down. Everyone will be humbled./_Do not forgive them.

17696.text: /Go in among the rocks and hide underground/_because of Yahweh’s terrifying presence/_and the honor of his majesty.

17697.text: /The eyes of arrogant people will be humbled./_High and mighty people will be brought down./_On that day Yahweh alone will be honored.

17698.text: §¶Yahweh Tsebaoth will have his day/_against all who are arrogant and conceited/_and all who are proud of themselves (they will be humbled),

17699.text: /against all the towering and mighty cedars of Lebanon/_and all the oaks of Bashan,

17700.text: /against all the high mountains/_and all the lofty hills,

17701.text: /against every high tower/_and every fortified wall,

17702.text: /against all the large ships of Tarshish/_and all the beautiful boats.

17703.text: ¶Then arrogant people will be brought down,/_and high and mighty people will be humbled./_On that day Yahweh alone will be honored.

17705.text: /People will go into caves in the rocks/_and into holes in the ground/_because of Yahweh’s terrifying presence/_and the honor of his majesty/_when he rises to terrify the earth.

17706.text: /On that day people will throw to the moles and the bats/_the silver and gold idols that they made/_for themselves to worship.

17707.text: /They will go into caves in the rocks/_and into cracks in the cliffs/_because of Yahweh’s terrifying presence/_and the honor of his majesty/_when he rises to terrify the earth.

17708.text: ¶Stop trusting people./_Their life is in their nostrils./_How can they be worth anything?

17709.text: §¶See now, Adonay, Yahweh Tsebaoth,/_is going to take from Jerusalem and Judah/_every kind of support/_and their entire supply of food and water.

17710.text: /He will take their heroes and soldiers,/_judges and prophets,/_fortunetellers and statesmen,

17711.text: /_military leaders and civilian leaders,/_counselors, skilled workers, and experts in magic.

17712.text: ¶“I will make boys their leaders./_Children will govern them.”

17713.text: ¶People will oppress each other,/_and everyone will oppress his neighbor./_The young will make fun of the old,/_and common people will make fun of their superiors.

17714.text: /A person will grab one of his relatives/_from his father’s family and say,/_“You have a coat./_You’ll be our leader./_This pile of ruins will be under your control.”

17715.text: /When that day comes the relative will cry out,/_“I’m not a doctor!/_I don’t have any food or a coat in my home./_Don’t make me a leader of our family.”

17716.text: ¶Jerusalem has stumbled, and Judah has fallen,/_because what they say and what they do is against Yahweh./_They are defiant in his honored presence.

17717.text: /The look on their faces will be held against them./_They boast about their sins,/_which are like those of the people of Sodom./_They don’t even bother to hide them./_How horrible it will be for these people,/_because they have brought disaster on themselves.

17718.text: ¶Tell the righteous that blessings will come to them./_They will taste the fruit of their labor.

17719.text: ¶How horrible it will be for the wicked! Disaster will strike them./_What they have done will be done to them.

17720.text: /“Children will oppress my people./_Women will rule them./_My people, your guides mislead you,/_and you don’t know which way to go.”

17721.text: /Yahweh takes his place in the courtroom./_He stands to judge his people.

17722.text: /Yahweh presents his case to the respected leaders/_and the officials of his people:/_“You have burned down the vineyard!/_Your houses are filled with goods stolen from the poor.”

17723.text: /Adonay Yahweh Tsebaoth asks,/_“How can you crush my people/_and grind the faces of the poor into the ground?”

17724.text: /Yahweh adds,/_“The women of Zion are arrogant./_They walk with their noses in the air,/_making seductive glances,/_taking short little steps,/_jingling the ankle bracelets on their feet.”

17725.text: /Adonay will cause sores to appear/_on the heads of the women of Zion,/_and Yahweh will make their foreheads bare.

17726.text: ¶On that day Adonay will take away their fine things: jingling anklets, headbands, crescent-shaped necklaces,

17728.text: hats, ankle bracelets, blouses, perfume boxes, charms,

17732.text: ¶Instead of the smell of perfume, there will be the smell of decay./_They will wear ropes instead of belts./_They will have bald heads instead of beautiful hair./_They will wear sackcloth instead of expensive clothes./_Their beauty will be scarred.

17733.text: /Women, your warriors will die in combat./_Your mighty men will die in battle.

17734.text: /The gates of Zion will cry and grieve,/_and Zion will sit on the ground, exhausted.

17735.text: ¶When that day comes, seven women will grab one man and say,/_“We’ll eat our own food and provide our own clothes./_Just let us marry you for your name./_Take away our disgrace.”

17736.text: §¶When that day comes, the branch of Yahweh/_will be beautiful and wonderful./_The fruit of the land/_will be the pride and joy of Israel’s survivors.

17737.text: ¶Then whoever is left in Zion and whoever remains in Jerusalem will be called holy, everyone who is recorded among the living in Jerusalem.

17738.text: Adonay will wash away the filth of Zion’s people. He will clean bloodstains from Jerusalem with a spirit of judgment and a spirit of burning.

17739.text: Yahweh will create a cloud of smoke during the day and a glowing flame of fire during the night over the whole area of Mount Zion and over the assembly. His glory will cover everything.

17740.text: It will be a shelter from the heat during the day as well as a refuge and hiding place from storms and rain.

17741.text: §¶Let me sing a lovesong to my beloved about his vineyard:¶▼My beloved had a vineyard on a fertile hill.

17742.text: /He dug it up, removed its stones,/_planted it with the choicest vines,/_built a watchtower in it,/_and made a winepress in it./_Then he waited for it to produce good grapes,/_but it produced only sour, wild grapes.

17743.text: ¶Now then, you inhabitants of Jerusalem and Judah,/_judge between me and my vineyard!

17744.text: /What more could have been done for my vineyard/_than what I have already done for it?/_When I waited for it to produce good grapes,/_why did it produce only sour, wild grapes?

17745.text: ¶Now then, let me tell you what I will do to my vineyard./_I will tear away its hedge so that it can be devoured/_and tear down its wall so that it can be trampled.

17746.text: /I will make it a wasteland./_It will never be pruned or hoed./_Thorns and weeds will grow in it,/_and I will command the clouds not to rain on it.

17747.text: ¶The vineyard of Yahweh Tsebaoth is the nation of Israel,/_and the people of Judah are the garden of his delight./_He hoped for justice but saw only slaughter,/_for righteousness but heard only cries of distress.

17748.text: §¶How horrible it will be for you/_who acquire house after house and buy field after field/_until there’s nothing left/_and you have to live by yourself in the land.

17749.text: ¶With my own ears I heard Yahweh Tsebaoth say,/_“Many houses will become empty./_Large, beautiful houses will be without people to live in them.

17750.text: /A ten-acre vineyard will produce only six gallons of wine,/_and two quarts of seed will produce only four quarts of grain.”

17751.text: ¶How horrible it will be for those/_who get up early to look for a drink,/_who sit up late until they are drunk from wine.

17752.text: /At their feasts there are lyres and harps,/_tambourines and flutes, and wine./_Yet, they don’t pay attention to what Yahweh is doing/_or see what his hands have done.

17753.text: ¶“My people will go into exile/_because they don’t understand what I’m doing./_Honored men will starve,/_and common people will be parched with thirst.”

17754.text: /That is why the grave’s appetite increases./_It opens its mouth very wide/_so that honored people and common people will go down into it./_Those who are noisy and joyous will go down into it.

17755.text: /People will be brought down. Everyone will be humbled./_And the eyes of arrogant people will be humbled.

17756.text: /Yahweh Tsebaoth will be honored when he judges./_The holy El will show himself to be holy when he does what is right.

17757.text: /Then lambs will graze as if they were in their own pasture,/_and foreigners will eat among the ruins of the rich.

17758.text: ¶How horrible it will be for those/_who string people along with lies and empty promises,/_whose lives are sinful.

17759.text: /They say,/_“Let Yahweh hurry and quickly do his work/_so that we may see what he has in mind./_Let the plan of Qedosh Yisrael happen quickly/_so that we may understand what he is doing.”

17760.text: ¶How horrible it will be for those/_who call evil good and good evil,/_who turn darkness into light and light into darkness,/_who turn what is bitter into something sweet/_and what is sweet into something bitter.

17761.text: ¶How horrible it will be for those/_who think they are wise/_and consider themselves to be clever.

17762.text: ¶How horrible it will be for those/_who are heroes at drinking wine,/_who are champions at mixing drinks,

17763.text: /who declare the guilty innocent for a bribe,/_who take away the rights of righteous people.

17764.text: §¶As flames burn up straw/_and dry grass shrivels in flames,/_so their roots will rot,/_and their blossoms will blow away like dust./_They have rejected the teachings of Yahweh Tsebaoth/_and have despised the word of Qedosh Yisrael.

17765.text: ¶That’s why the anger of Yahweh burns hot against his people,/_and he is ready to use his power to strike them down./_The hills tremble,/_and dead bodies lie like garbage in the streets.¶Even after all this, his anger has not disappeared,/_and he is still ready to use his power.

17766.text: ¶Yahweh raises up a flag for the nations far away./_With a whistle he signals those at the ends of the earth./_Look, they are coming very quickly!

17767.text: /None of them grow tired or stumble./_None of them slumber or sleep./_The belts on their waists aren’t loose/_or their sandal straps broken.

17768.text: /Their arrows are sharpened; all their bows are ready to shoot./_Their horses’ hoofs are as hard as flint./_Their chariot wheels are as quick as the wind.

17769.text: /They roar like a lioness./_They growl like a young lion./_They growl as they snatch their prey/_and carry it off to where no one can rescue it.

17770.text: /On that day they will roar over their prey/_as the sea roars./_If they look at the land,/_they will see only darkness and distress./_Even the light will be darkened by thick clouds.

17771.text: §¶In the year King Uzziah died, I saw Adonay sitting on a high and lofty throne. The bottom of his robe filled the temple.

17772.text: Angels were standing above him. Each had six wings: With two they covered their faces, with two they covered their feet, and with two they flew.

17773.text: They called to each other and said,¶▼“Holy, holy, holy is Yahweh Tsebaoth!/_The whole earth is filled with his glory.”

17774.text: ¶Their voices shook the foundations of the doorposts, and the temple filled with smoke.

17775.text: ¶So I said, “Oh, no!¶▼I’m doomed./_Every word that passes through my lips is sinful./_I live among people with sinful lips./_I have seen the Melek, Yahweh Tsebaoth!”

17776.text: ¶Then one of the angels flew to me. In his hand was a burning coal that he had taken from the altar with tongs.

17777.text: He touched my mouth with it and said, “This has touched your lips. Your guilt has been taken away, and your sin has been forgiven.”

17778.text: ¶Then I heard the voice of Adonay, saying, “Whom will I send? Who will go for us?”¶I said, “Here I am. Send me!”

17779.text: ¶And he said, “Go and tell these people,¶▼‘No matter how closely you listen, you’ll never understand./_No matter how closely you look, you’ll never see.’

17780.text: /Make these people close-minded./_Plug their ears./_Shut their eyes./_Otherwise, they may see with their eyes,/_hear with their ears,/_understand with their minds,/_and return and be healed.”

17781.text: ¶I asked, “How long, O Adonay?”¶And he replied,¶▼“Until the cities lie in ruins with no one living in them,/_the houses have no people,/_and the land is completely desolate.

17782.text: /Yahweh will send his people far away,/_and a large area in the middle of the land will be abandoned.

17783.text: /Even if one out of ten people is left in it,/_the land will be burned again./_When a sacred oak or an oak is cut down, a stump is left./_The holy seed will be the land’s stump.”

17784.text: §¶When Ahaz, son of Jotham and grandson of Uzziah, was king of Judah, Aram’s King Rezin and Israel’s King Pekah, son of Remaliah, went to Jerusalem to attack it, but they couldn’t defeat it.

17785.text: When word reached David’s family that the Arameans had made an alliance with Ephraim, the hearts of the king and his people were shaken as the trees of the forest are shaken by the wind.

17786.text: ¶Then Yahweh said to Isaiah, “Go out with your son Shear Jashub to meet Ahaz at the end of the ditch of the Upper Pool on the road to the Laundryman’s Field.

17787.text: Say to him, ‘Be careful, stay calm, and don’t be afraid. Don’t lose heart because of the fierce anger of Rezin from Aram and Remaliah’s son. These two are smoldering logs.’

17788.text: Aram, Ephraim, and Remaliah’s son have planned evil against you, saying,

17789.text: ‘Let’s march against Judah, tear it apart, divide it among ourselves, and set up Tabeel’s son as its king.’

17790.text: This is what Adonay Yahweh says:¶▼It won’t take place; it won’t happen.

17791.text: /The capital of Aram is Damascus,/_and the leader of Damascus is Rezin./_Ephraim will be shattered within 65 years/_so that it will no longer be a nation.

17792.text: /The capital of Ephraim is Samaria,/_and the leader of Samaria is Remaliah’s son./_If you don’t remain faithful,/_you won’t remain standing.

17794.text: “Ask Yahweh your Elohim for a sign. It can be anything you want.”

17795.text: ¶But Ahaz answered, “I won’t ask; I wouldn’t think of testing Yahweh.”

17796.text: ¶“Listen now, descendants of David,” Isaiah said. “Isn’t it enough that you try the patience of mortals? Must you also try the patience of my Elohim?

17797.text: So Adonay himself will give you this sign: A virgin will become pregnant and give birth to a son, and she will name him Immanuel [God Is With Us].

17798.text: He will eat cheese and honey until he knows how to reject evil and choose good.

17799.text: Indeed, before the boy knows how to reject evil and choose good, the land of the two kings who terrify you will be deserted.

17800.text: ¶“Yahweh will bring on you, your people, and your ancestor’s family a time unlike any since Ephraim broke away from Judah. He will bring the king of Assyria.

17801.text: On that day Yahweh will whistle for the flies that are at the distant branches of the Nile River in Egypt and for the bees that are in Assyria.

17802.text: All of them will come and settle in the deep valleys, in the cracks in the cliffs, on all the thornbushes, and at all the water holes.

17803.text: ¶“On that day Adonay will hire the king of Assyria from beyond the Euphrates River to be a razor to shave the hair on your head, the hair on your legs, and even your beard.

17804.text: On that day a person will keep alive a young cow and two sheep.

17805.text: That person will eat cheese, because they will produce so much milk. Everyone who is left in the land will eat cheese and honey.

17806.text: On that day, in every place where there were 1,000 vines (worth 1,000 pieces of silver), there will be briars and thorns.

17807.text: People will come there with bows and arrows to hunt because the whole land will be filled with briars and thorns.

17808.text: And you will no longer be able to go to all the hills which used to be cultivated because they will be filled with briars and thorns. It will be a place for turning oxen loose and letting sheep run.”

17809.text: §¶Yahweh said to me, “Take a large writing tablet, and write on it with a pen: ‘Maher Shalal Hash Baz’ [The Looting Will Come Quickly; the Prey Will Be Easy].

17810.text: I will have these dependable witnesses testify: the priest Uriah and Zechariah (son of Jeberechiah).”

17811.text: ¶I slept with the prophet. She became pregnant and gave birth to a son. Yahweh told me, “Name him Maher Shalal Hash Baz.

17812.text: Before the boy knows how to say ‘Daddy’ or ‘Mommy,’ the wealth of Damascus and the loot from Samaria will be carried away to the king of Assyria.”

17813.text: §¶Yahweh spoke to me again. He said,

17814.text: ¶“These people have rejected the gently flowing water of Shiloah/_and find joy in Rezin and Remaliah’s son.”

17815.text: /That is why Adonay is going to bring against them/_the raging and powerful floodwaters of the Euphrates River—/_the king of Assyria with all his power./_It will overflow all its channels and go over all its banks.

17816.text: /It will sweep through Judah./_It will overflow and pass through; it will be neck-high./_Its outspread wings will extend over your whole country, O Immanuel.

17817.text: ¶Be broken, you people. Be terrified./_Listen, all you distant parts of the earth./_Prepare for battle, but be terrified./_Prepare for battle, but be terrified.

17818.text: ¶Make plans for battle, but they will never succeed./_Give orders, but they won’t be carried out,/_because El is with us!

17819.text: §¶This is what Yahweh said with his powerful hand on me.¶▼He warned me not to follow the ways of these people:

17820.text: /“Don’t say that everything these people call a conspiracy/_is a conspiracy./_Don’t fear what they fear./_Don’t let it terrify you.”

17821.text: /Remember that Yahweh Tsebaoth is holy./_He is the one you should fear/_and the one you should be terrified of.

17822.text: /He will be a place of safety for you./_But he will be a rock that makes people trip/_and a stumbling block for both kingdoms of Israel./_He will be a trap and a snare for those who live in Jerusalem.

17823.text: /_Many will stumble./_They will fall and be broken./_They will be trapped and caught.

17824.text: ¶Tie up the written instructions./_Seal the teachings among my disciples.

17825.text: ¶I will wait for Yahweh,/_who hides his face from the descendants of Jacob./_I will hope in him.

17826.text: /I am here with the children that Yahweh has given me./_We are signs and symbols in Israel/_from Yahweh Tsebaoth, who lives on Mount Zion.

17827.text: /People will say to you, “Ask for help from the mediums/_and the fortunetellers, who whisper and mutter.”/_Shouldn’t people ask their Elohim for help instead?/_Why should they ask the dead to help the living?

17828.text: /They should go to the teachings and to the written instructions./_If people don’t speak these words,/_it is because it doesn’t dawn on them.

17829.text: /They will pass through the land when they are hard-pressed and hungry./_When they are hungry, they will be furious./_Then they will look up, cursing their king and Elohim.

17830.text: /They will look at the earth and see only distress and gloom./_They will go in anguish and be forced into darkness.

17831.text: ¶But there will be no more gloom/_for the land that is in distress./_Elohim humbled the lands of Zebulun and Naphtali in earlier times./_But in the future he will bring glory to the road by the sea,/_to the land across the Jordan River,/_to Galilee, where foreigners live.

17832.text: §¶The people who walk in darkness will see a bright light./_The light will shine on those who live in the land of death’s shadow.

17833.text: ¶You will expand the nation and increase its happiness./_It will be happy in your presence/_like those who celebrate the harvest/_or rejoice when dividing loot.

17834.text: /You will break the yoke that burdens them,/_the bar that is across their shoulders,/_and the stick used by their oppressor,/_as you did in the battle against Midian.

17835.text: /Every warrior’s boot marching to the sound of battle/_and every garment rolled in blood/_will be burned as fuel in the fire.

17836.text: /A child will be born for us./_A son will be given to us./_The government will rest on his shoulders./_He will be named:/_Wonderful Counselor,/_Mighty God,/_Everlasting Father,/_Sar Shalom.

17837.text: /His government and peace will have unlimited growth./_He will establish David’s throne and kingdom./_He will uphold it with justice and righteousness now and forever./_Yahweh Tsebaoth is determined to do this!

17838.text: §¶Adonay sent a message against Jacob./_The message is against Israel.

17839.text: /All the people of Ephraim/_and the people who live in Samaria will know it./_With arrogant and conceited hearts they will say,

17840.text: /“Bricks have fallen,/_but we will rebuild with hand-cut stones./_Fig trees have been cut down,/_but we will replace them with cedars.”

17841.text: /Yahweh will set Rezin’s oppressors against Israel/_and will stir up its enemies—

17842.text: /the Arameans from the east and the Philistines from the west./_They will devour Israel with open mouths.¶Even after all this, his anger will not disappear,/_and he is still ready to use his power.

17843.text: ¶But the people have not returned to the one who struck them,/_nor have they sought Yahweh Tsebaoth.

17844.text: /So in one day Yahweh will cut off from Israel/_both head and tail,/_both palm branches and cattails.

17845.text: /Respected and honored leaders are the head./_Prophets who teach lies are the tail.

17846.text: /Those who guide these people lead them astray./_Those who are guided by them will be destroyed.

17847.text: /That is why Adonay isn’t happy with their young men,/_nor will he show compassion for their orphans and widows./_Every one of them is a godless evildoer,/_and every mouth speaks foolishness.¶Even after all this, his anger will not disappear,/_and he is still ready to use his power.

17848.text: ¶Surely wickedness burns like fire./_It burns up briars and thorns./_It sets the underbrush in the forest on fire,/_and it whirls upward in clouds of smoke.

17849.text: /The land is scorched by the fury of Yahweh Tsebaoth,/_and the people are like fuel for the fire./_No one shows concern for others:

17850.text: /On the right, one gobbles up food and is still hungry./_On the left, another eats and is never full./_Each person eats the flesh from his own arm.

17851.text: /Manasseh is against Ephraim./_Ephraim is against Manasseh./_Together they attack Judah.¶Even after all this, his anger will not disappear,/_and he is still ready to use his power.

17852.text: ¶How horrible it will be for those who make unjust laws/_and who make oppressive regulations.

17853.text: /_They deprive the poor of justice./_They take away the rights of the needy among my people./_They prey on widows and rob orphans.

17854.text: /What will you do on the day/_you are called to account for these things,/_when the disaster comes from far away?/_Where will you run for help?/_Where will you leave your wealth?

17855.text: /Nothing’s left but to crouch among prisoners/_and to fall with those who are killed.¶Even after all this, his anger will not disappear,/_and he is still ready to use his power.

17856.text: §¶“How horrible it will be for Assyria!/_It is the rod of my anger./_My fury is the staff in the Assyrians’ hands.

17857.text: /I send them against a godless nation./_In my fury I order them against the people/_to take their belongings, loot them,/_and trample on them like mud in the streets.

17858.text: /But that’s not what they intend to do./_Their minds don’t work that way./_Their purpose is to destroy and put an end to many nations.

17860.text: /Isn’t Calno like Carchemish?/_Isn’t Hamath like Arpad?/_Isn’t Samaria like Damascus?’

17861.text: /My power has reached kingdoms which have idols./_They had more carved statues than Jerusalem or Samaria.

17862.text: /I will do to Jerusalem and its idols/_what I’ve done to Samaria and its idols.”

17863.text: ¶When Adonay has finished all his work on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, he will punish the king of Assyria for all his boasting and all his arrogance.

17864.text: The king will say,¶▼“I did this with my own two powerful hands./_I did this with my wisdom, because I am so clever./_I’ve eliminated the boundaries of nations./_I’ve looted treasuries./_I’ve brought down people like a mighty man.

17865.text: /I’ve found the riches of nations as one finds a nest./_I’ve gathered the whole world as one gathers abandoned eggs./_Not one of them flapped a wing, opened its mouth, or peeped.”

17866.text: ¶Can an ax attack the person who cuts with it?/_Can a saw make itself greater than the person who saws with it?/_A rod cannot move the person who lifts it./_A wooden stick cannot pick up a person.

17867.text: /That is why Adonay Yahweh Tsebaoth/_will send a degenerative disease against brave men./_A flame will be turned into a raging fire under his power.

17868.text: /Israel’s light will become a flame./_Its Holy One will become a fire./_He will burn up and devour the weeds and thornbushes in one day.

17869.text: /The majestic forest and the orchard/_will destroy both body and soul./_They will be like a sick person wasting away.

17870.text: /The trees that remain in the forest will be so few that/_a child could count them.

17871.text: ¶At that time the remaining few Israelites,/_the survivors of Jacob’s descendants/_will no longer depend on the one who struck them./_They will only depend on Yahweh, Qedosh Yisrael.

17872.text: /A few, the remaining few of Jacob, will return to the mighty God.

17873.text: /Although your people Israel may be/_as numerous as the grains of sand on the seashore,/_only a few will return./_Destruction will be complete and fair.

17874.text: /Adonay Yahweh Tsebaoth will carry out this destruction/_throughout the world as he has determined.

17875.text: /Adonay Yahweh Tsebaoth says:/_My people who live in Zion,/_don’t be afraid of the Assyrians when they strike with a rod/_or when they raise their staff against you/_as the Egyptians did.

17876.text: /Very soon I will unleash my fury,/_and my anger will destroy them.

17877.text: ¶Then Yahweh Tsebaoth will raise his whip against them./_As he struck down Midian at the Rock of Oreb/_and raised his staff over the water,/_so he will lift it as he did in Egypt.

17878.text: /At that time their burden will be removed from your shoulders./_Their yoke will be removed from your neck./_The yoke will be torn away because you have grown fat.

17879.text: ¶They come to Aiath./_They pass through Migron./_They store their equipment at Michmash.

17880.text: /They go through the mountain pass and lodge at Geba for the night./_The people in Ramah tremble; the people in Saul’s Gibeah flee.

17881.text: /Cry aloud, you people in Gallim!/_Pay attention, you people in Laishah and miserable Anathoth!

17882.text: /The people in Madmenah flee; those who live in Gebim take shelter.

17883.text: /This day they stopped at Nob./_They shake their fist at the mountain of my people Zion,/_at the mountain of Jerusalem.

17884.text: /Now look! Adonay Yahweh Tsebaoth/_will trim the branches with terrifying power./_The highest trees will be cut down./_The tallest ones will be brought down.

17885.text: /He will cut down the underbrush of the forest with an ax./_Lebanon will fall in front of the Mighty One.

17886.text: §¶Then a shoot will come out from the stump of Jesse,/_and a branch from its roots will bear fruit.

17887.text: /The Ruach Yahweh will rest on him—/_the Ruach of wisdom and understanding,/_the Ruach of advice and power,/_the Ruach of knowledge and fear of Yahweh.

17888.text: /He will gladly bear the fear of Yahweh./_He will not judge by what his eyes see/_or decide by what his ears hear.

17889.text: /He will judge the poor justly./_He will make fair decisions for the humble people on earth./_He will strike the earth with a rod from his mouth./_He will kill the wicked with the breath from his lips.

17890.text: /Justice will be the belt around his waist./_Faithfulness will be the belt around his hips.

17891.text: ¶Wolves will live with lambs./_Leopards will lie down with goats./_Calves, young lions, and year-old lambs will be together,/_and little children will lead them.

17892.text: /Cows and bears will eat together./_Their young will lie down together./_Lions will eat straw like oxen.

17893.text: /Infants will play near cobras’ holes./_Toddlers will put their hands into vipers’ nests.

17894.text: /They will not hurt or destroy anyone anywhere on my holy mountain./_The world will be filled with the knowledge of Yahweh/_like water covering the sea.

17895.text: /At that time the root of Jesse will stand as a banner/_for the people to gather around./_The nations will come to him./_His resting place will be glorious.

17896.text: ¶At that time Adonay will use his power again/_to recover what remains of his people/_in Assyria, Upper and Lower Egypt,/_Sudan, Elam, Babylonia, Hamath,/_and the islands of the sea.

17897.text: /He will raise a banner for the nations to gather around./_He will gather the outcasts of Israel/_and bring together the scattered people of Judah/_from the four corners of the earth.

17898.text: /Ephraim’s jealousy will vanish,/_and Judah’s opponents will come to an end./_Ephraim won’t be jealous of Judah,/_and Judah won’t oppose Ephraim.

17899.text: /They will swoop down on the slopes of Philistia in the west./_Together they will loot the people of the east./_They will conquer Edom and Moab./_The people of Ammon will be subject to them.

17900.text: /Yahweh will dry up the gulf of the Egyptian Sea./_He will wave his hand over the Euphrates River with his scorching wind/_and divide it into seven streams/_so that people can walk over it in their sandals.

17901.text: /There will be a highway/_for the remaining few of his people left in Assyria/_like there was for Israel when it came out of Egypt.

17902.text: §¶At that time you will say,¶▼“I will praise you, O Yahweh./_Although you had been angry with me,/_you turned your anger away from me, and you comforted me.

17903.text: /Look! El is my Savior./_I am confident and unafraid,/_because Yah is my strength and my song./_He is my Savior.”

17904.text: ¶With joy you will draw water from the springs of salvation.

17905.text: ¶At that time you will say,¶▼“Praise Yahweh./_Call on his name./_Make his deeds known among the nations./_Make them remember that his name is highly honored.

17906.text: /Make music to praise Yahweh./_He has done wonderful things./_Let this be known throughout the earth.

17907.text: /Shout loudly, and sing with joy, people of Zion!/_Qedosh Yisrael is great. He is among you.”

17908.text: §¶This is the divine revelation which Isaiah, son of Amoz, saw about Babylon.

17909.text: ¶Raise a banner on the bare mountaintop./_Call loudly to them./_Signal them with your hand to enter the nobles’ gates.

17910.text: /I’ve commanded my holy ones./_I’ve called my mighty men to carry out my anger./_They find joy in my triumphs.

17911.text: /Listen to the noise on the mountains./_It is like the sound of a large army./_It is the sound of kingdoms and nations gathering together./_Yahweh Tsebaoth is assembling his army for battle.

17912.text: /His army is coming from a distant land,/_from the ends of heaven./_Yahweh is coming with the weapons of his fury/_to destroy the whole world.

17913.text: ¶Cry loudly, for the day of Yahweh is near./_It will come like destruction from Shadday.

17914.text: /That is why every hand will hang limp,/_and everyone’s courage will fail.

17915.text: /_They’ll be terrified./_Pain and anguish will seize them./_They’ll writhe like a woman giving birth to a child./_They’ll look at one another in astonishment./_Their faces will be burning red.

17916.text: ¶The day of Yahweh is going to come./_It will be a cruel day with fury and fierce anger./_He will make the earth desolate./_He will destroy its sinners.

17917.text: /The stars in the sky and their constellations/_won’t show their light anymore./_The sun will be dark when it rises./_The moon won’t shine.

17918.text: ¶I will punish the world for its evil/_and the wicked for their wrongdoing./_I will put an end to arrogant people/_and humble the pride of tyrants.

17919.text: /I will make people harder to find than pure gold/_and human beings more rare than gold from Ophir.

17920.text: /I will make heaven tremble,/_and the earth will be shaken from its place/_when Yahweh Tsebaoth is angry./_At that time he will be very angry.

17921.text: ¶They’ll be like hunted gazelle/_and like sheep with no one to gather them./_Everyone will return to his own people/_and flee to his own land.

17922.text: /Whoever is found will be stabbed to death./_Whoever is captured will be executed.

17923.text: /Their little children will be smashed to death right before their eyes./_Their houses will be looted and their wives raped.

17924.text: ¶I’m going to stir up the Medes against them./_They don’t care for silver and aren’t happy with gold.

17925.text: /But their bows will smash the youth./_They’ll have no compassion for babies,/_nor will they look with pity on children.

17926.text: ¶Babylon, the jewel of the kingdoms,/_the proud beauty of the Chaldeans,/_will be like Sodom and Gomorrah when Elohim destroyed them.

17927.text: /It will never be inhabited again,/_and no one will live in it for generations./_Arabs won’t pitch their tents there./_Shepherds won’t let their flocks rest there.

17928.text: /Desert animals will lie down there./_Their homes will be full of owls./_Ostriches will live there,/_and wild goats will skip about.

17929.text: /Hyenas will howl in Babylon’s strongholds,/_and jackals will howl in its luxurious palaces.¶Its time has almost come./_Its days will not be extended.

17930.text: §¶Yahweh will have compassion for Jacob and again choose Israel./_He will resettle them in their own country./_Foreigners will join them/_and unite with the descendants of Jacob.

17931.text: /People will take them/_and bring them to their own place./_The nation of Israel will possess nations/_as male and female slaves in Yahweh’s land./_They will take their captors captive/_and rule their oppressors.

17932.text: ¶When that day comes, Yahweh will give you relief/_from your pain and suffering,/_from the hard slavery you were forced to do.

17933.text: /Then you will mock the king of Babylon with this saying,/_“How the tyrant has come to an end!/_How his attacks have come to an end!”

17934.text: /Yahweh has broken the staff of the wicked,/_the scepter of rulers.

17935.text: /_They struck the people with fury,/_with blows that didn’t stop./_They ruled nations in anger,/_persecuting them without restraint.

17936.text: /The whole earth rests and is peaceful./_It breaks out into shouts of joy.

17937.text: /Even the cypresses rejoice over you./_The cedars of Lebanon say,/_“Since you have fallen,/_no lumberjack has come to attack us.”

17938.text: ¶Sheol below wakes up to meet you when you come./_It wakes up the ghosts of the dead,/_all who were leaders on earth./_It raises all who were kings of the nations from their thrones.

17939.text: /All of them will greet you,/_“You also have become weak like us!/_You have become like one of us!”

17940.text: /Your pride has been brought down to Sheol/_along with the music of your harps./_Maggots are spread out like a bed under you,/_and worms cover you.

17941.text: ¶How you have fallen from heaven, you morning star, son of the dawn!/_How you have been cut down to the ground, you conqueror of nations!

17942.text: /You thought,/_“I’ll go up to heaven and set up my throne above El’s stars./_I’ll sit on the mountain far away in the north/_where the gods assemble.

17943.text: /I’ll go above the top of the clouds./_I’ll be like Elyon.”

17944.text: /But you’ve been brought down to Sheol,/_to the deepest part of the pit.

17945.text: /Those who see you stare at you; they look at you closely and say,/_“Is this the man who made the earth tremble,/_who shook the kingdoms,

17946.text: /who made the world like a desert and tore down its cities,/_who didn’t let his prisoners go home?”

17947.text: ¶All the kings of the nations, all of them,/_have been buried with honor, each in his own tomb.

17948.text: /But you are thrown out of your tomb like a rejected branch./_You are covered with those who were killed in battle./_You go down to the stones of the pit like a trampled corpse.

17949.text: /You won’t be joined by the kings in the tomb,/_because you have destroyed your land and killed your people.¶The descendants of the wicked will never be mentioned again.

17950.text: /Prepare a place to slaughter their sons/_because of their ancestors’ guilt./_They won’t be able to rise, possess the earth,/_and rebuild cities all over it.

17951.text: ¶“I’ll rise up against them,” declares Yahweh Tsebaoth./_“I’ll cut off the name of the survivors from Babylon,/_its offspring and descendants,” declares Yahweh.

17952.text: /“It will become the possession of herons./_It will become pools of water./_I’ll sweep it with the broom of destruction,” declares Yahweh Tsebaoth.

17953.text: §¶Yahweh Tsebaoth has taken an oath:/_“It will happen exactly as I’ve intended./_It will turn out exactly as I’ve planned.

17954.text: /I’ll crush Assyria on my land./_I’ll trample it underfoot on my mountains./_Then its yoke will be removed from my people,/_and its burden will be removed from their shoulders.”

17955.text: ¶This is the plan determined for the whole earth./_This is how he will use his power against all the nations.

17956.text: /Yahweh Tsebaoth has planned it. Who can stop it?/_He is ready to use his power. Who can turn it back?

17957.text: §¶This was the divine revelation in the year King Ahaz died.

17958.text: ¶All you Philistines, don’t rejoice/_that the rod of the one who struck you is broken,/_because a viper will come from that snake’s root,/_and his descendant will be a flying, fiery serpent.

17959.text: /The poorest of the poor will eat,/_and the needy will lie down in safety./_But I will put your root to death with famine/_and kill off your survivors.

17960.text: ¶Cry loudly in the gate!/_Cry out in the city!/_Be frightened, all you Philistines!/_Smoke comes from the north,/_and there are no stragglers in its ranks.

17961.text: /How should we answer the messengers from the nations?/_Tell them that Yahweh has laid Zion’s foundation,/_and his humble people will find refuge in it.

17962.text: §¶This is the divine revelation about Moab.¶▼In a single night Ar in Moab is laid waste and destroyed!/_In a single night Kir in Moab is laid waste and destroyed!

17963.text: /The people of Dibon go to the temple,/_to the worship sites, to cry./_Moab wails over Nebo and Medeba./_Every head is shaved bald, and every beard is cut off.

17964.text: /In their streets they wear sackcloth./_On their roofs and in their city squares everyone wails and cries.

17965.text: /Heshbon and Elealeh also cry out./_Their voices are heard as far away as Jahaz./_Moab’s armed men cry out./_Their courage is gone.

17966.text: /My heart cries out for Moab./_Its people flee as far as Zoar at Eglath Shelishiyah./_They go up the mountain road to Luhith./_They cry loudly over the destruction on the way to Horonaim.

17967.text: /The Nimrim Brook has run dry!/_The grass dries up,/_the vegetation withers,/_and nothing green is left.

17968.text: /That is why they carry the wealth that they have earned and stored up/_over Willow Ravine.

17969.text: /Cries for help echo throughout the land of Moab./_Their wailing echoes as far as Eglaim./_Their wailing echoes as far as Beer Elim.

17970.text: /The water in Dimon is red with blood,/_yet I will bring even more on Dimon./_A lion will attack the fugitives from Moab/_and the survivors from Adamah.

17971.text: ¶Send lambs to the ruler of the land./_Send lambs from Sela through the desert to my people at Mount Zion.

17972.text: /Moab’s daughters are like fluttering birds,/_like scattered nestlings,/_at the shallow crossings of the Arnon River.

17973.text: ¶Give us advice./_Make a decision./_At high noon make your shadow as dark as night./_Hide the fugitives./_Don’t betray the refugees.

17974.text: /Let the fugitives from Moab stay with you a while./_Be their refuge from the destroyer./_Ruthless people will come to an end./_The destruction will end./_The one who tramples others will be gone.

17975.text: /Then Yahweh will set up a trusted king./_He will rule faithfully./_He is from the tent of David./_He judges and searches for justice./_He is quick to do what is right.

17976.text: ¶We’ve heard of the arrogance of Moab’s people./_They are very arrogant./_We’ve heard of their boasting, arrogance, and conceit,/_but their boasts aren’t true.

17977.text: /That is why Moab will wail./_Everyone will wail for Moab./_Mourn and grieve over the raisin cakes of Kir Hareseth.

17978.text: /The fields of Heshbon and the vineyards of Sibmah wither./_Rulers of the nations have cut off their grapes./_The grapevines once reached as far as Jazer/_and strayed out into the desert./_Their shoots had spread out over the sea.

17979.text: /I will cry for the grapevines of Sibmah/_as Jazer cries for them./_I will drench you with my tears, Heshbon and Elealeh./_The shouts of joy for your ripened fruits/_and your harvest will be silenced.

17980.text: /Joy and delight have vanished from the orchards./_No songs are sung./_No shouts are raised./_No one stomps on grapes in the winepresses,/_because I have put an end to the shouts of joy.

17981.text: /That is why my heart mourns for Moab like a harp./_My soul mourns for Kir Hareseth.

17982.text: /When the people of Moab appear at the worship site,/_they will only wear themselves out./_They will come into the holy place to pray,/_but they won’t be able to.

17983.text: ¶This is the message that Yahweh spoke about Moab in the past.

17984.text: But now Yahweh says, “Moab’s honor will be despised within three years. I will count them like workers count the years left of their contracts. In spite of their great number, the survivors will be very few and powerless.”

17985.text: §¶This is the divine revelation about Damascus.¶▼“Damascus will no longer be a city./_It will become a pile of rubble.

17986.text: /The cities of Aroer will be deserted./_These cities will be used for sheep, which will lie down in them./_There will be no one to disturb those sheep.

17987.text: /Fortified cities will disappear from Ephraim,/_and the kingdom will disappear from Damascus./_The remaining few from Aram will share Israel’s honor,”/_declares Yahweh Tsebaoth.

17988.text: ¶“When that day comes, the honor of Jacob’s people will fade away,/_and they will become skin and bones.

17989.text: /That time will be like harvesting bundles of grain by the armful./_It will be like gathering grain in the Rephaim Valley.

17990.text: /Only a few people will survive./_They will be like an olive tree that has been beaten./_Only two or three olives are left/_at the top of the highest branch,/_four or five olives on the rest of the branches,”/_declares Yahweh Elohim of Israel.

17991.text: ¶When that day comes, they will look to their maker,/_and their eyes will look to Qedosh Yisrael.

17992.text: /They won’t look to the altars made by their hands/_or to the Asherah poles or incense altars/_which their fingers molded.

17993.text: ¶When that day comes, the fortified cities/_which other people abandoned because of the Israelites/_will be like abandoned woods and undergrowth./_So it will become a wasteland.

17994.text: ¶You have forgotten the Elohim of your salvation./_You haven’t remembered the rock, your stronghold./_Instead, you have planted the best plants/_and have set out the imported grapevines.

17995.text: /On the day you plant, you will make it grow./_On the morning you set out the seedling, you will make it sprout./_But the harvest will become a [rotting] pile/_on a day of grief and incurable pain.

17996.text: ¶How horrible it will be for many people!/_They will roar like the roaring sea./_The noise that the people make/_will be like the noise from rushing water.

17997.text: /The people will make noise like raging water./_But Elohim will yell at them, and they will run far away./_They will be chased away/_like husks on the mountains being blown by the wind,/_like whirling dust being blown by a storm.

17998.text: /In the evening there will be sudden terror./_Before morning they will be gone./_This will be the fate of those who looted us,/_the destiny of those who robbed us.

17999.text: §¶How horrible it will be for the land of whirring wings/_which lies beyond the rivers of Sudan.

18000.text: /_It sends messengers by sea/_in boats made of reeds/_skimming over the surface of the water./_Go, swift messengers, to a tall and smooth-skinned people,/_a people who are feared far and near,/_a strong and aggressive nation,/_whose land is divided by rivers.

18001.text: /Look when someone raises a flag on the mountains./_Listen when someone blows a ram’s horn,/_all you inhabitants of the world who live on the earth.

18002.text: ¶This is what Yahweh says to me:¶▼I will keep quiet and watch from my dwelling place./_My presence will be like scorching heat in the sunshine,/_like heavy dew in the heat of the harvest.

18003.text: /Before the harvest, when blossoms are gone/_and grapes are ripening from blossoms,/_he will cut off the shoots with pruning shears/_and chop off the spreading branches.

18004.text: /They will be left for the birds of prey on the mountains/_and the wild animals./_The birds of prey will feed on them in the summer,/_and all the wild animals on earth/_will feed on them in the winter.

18005.text: /At that time gifts will be brought to Yahweh Tsebaoth/_from a tall and smooth-skinned people,/_a people who are feared far and near,/_a strong and aggressive nation,/_whose land is divided by rivers./_They will be brought to Mount Zion,/_the place where the name of Yahweh Tsebaoth is.

18006.text: §¶This is the divine revelation about Egypt.¶▼Yahweh is riding on a fast-moving cloud and is coming to Egypt./_Egypt’s idols will tremble in his presence./_Egypt’s courage will fail.

18007.text: ¶“I will turn one Egyptian against another./_They will fight—/_brother against brother,/_neighbor against neighbor,/_city against city,/_kingdom against kingdom.

18008.text: /The Egyptians will lose courage./_I will unravel their plans./_They will turn to idols, ghosts,/_mediums, and fortunetellers.

18009.text: /I will hand over the Egyptians to a harsh master./_A strong king will rule them,”/_declares Adonay Yahweh Tsebaoth.

18010.text: ¶The water in the Nile River will be dried up,/_and the river will be dry and empty.

18011.text: /The canals will stink./_Egypt’s streams will be emptied and dried up./_The reeds and cattails will wither.

18012.text: /The rushes by the Nile, by the edge of the Nile,/_and all the fields planted beside the Nile/_will dry up, be blown away, and disappear.

18013.text: /Fishermen will cry./_All who cast their lines into the Nile will mourn./_Those who spread their nets on the water will sigh.

18015.text: /Egypt’s weavers will be crushed./_Those who work for money will be distressed.

18016.text: ¶The leaders of Zoan are nothing but fools./_The wisest of Pharaoh’s counselors gives stupid advice./_How can you tell Pharaoh,/_“I’m a descendant of wise men,/_a descendant of ancient kings”?

18017.text: /Where are your wise men now?/_Let them tell you./_Let them explain what Yahweh Tsebaoth/_is planning against Egypt.

18018.text: /The leaders of Zoan are acting foolishly./_The leaders of Memphis are led astray./_The leaders who are the cornerstones of its tribes mislead the Egyptians.

18019.text: /Yahweh mixes up their minds./_So they lead the Egyptians astray/_like a drunk who staggers in his vomit.

18020.text: /No one—leaders or followers, important or unimportant—/_can do anything for Egypt.

18021.text: ¶At that time Egyptians will act like women. They will tremble and be terrified because Yahweh Tsebaoth will shake his fist at them.

18022.text: The land of Judah will terrify the Egyptians. Whenever they are reminded of Judah, they will be terrified of it because of what Yahweh Tsebaoth is planning against it.

18023.text: ¶When that day comes, five cities in Egypt will have people that speak the language of Canaan and swear allegiance to Yahweh Tsebaoth. One of the cities will be called Heliopolis.

18024.text: ¶When that day comes, an altar for Yahweh will be in the middle of Egypt, and a stone marker for Yahweh will be near its border.

18025.text: These objects will be a sign and a witness that Yahweh Tsebaoth is in Egypt. When the people cry to Yahweh because of those who oppress them, he will send a savior and defender to rescue them.

18026.text: So Yahweh will make himself known to the Egyptians. The Egyptians will know Yahweh when that day comes. They will worship with sacrifices and food offerings. They will make vows to Yahweh and carry them out.

18027.text: Yahweh will strike Egypt with a plague. When he strikes them, he will also heal them. Then they will come back to Yahweh. And he will respond to their prayers and heal them.

18028.text: ¶When that day comes, a highway will run from Egypt to Assyria. The Assyrians will come to Egypt and the Egyptians to Assyria, and the Egyptians will worship with the Assyrians.

18029.text: When that day comes, Israel will be one-third of God’s people, along with Egypt and Assyria. They will be a blessing on the earth.

18030.text: Yahweh Tsebaoth will bless them, saying, “My people Egypt, the work of my hands Assyria, and my possession Israel are blessed.”

18031.text: §¶In the year when King Sargon of Assyria sent his commander-in-chief to fight against Ashdod, he captured it.

18032.text: At that time Yahweh told Isaiah, son of Amoz, “Take off the sackcloth that you are wearing, and take off your sandals!” Isaiah did this and walked around barefoot and naked.

18033.text: ¶Then Yahweh said, “My servant Isaiah has gone barefoot and naked for three years as a sign and as an omen to Egypt and Sudan.

18034.text: The king of Assyria will lead away both the young and the old—captives from Egypt and exiles from Sudan. They will be barefoot and naked. Their buttocks will be exposed in order to disgrace Egypt.

18035.text: Then the people will be shattered and ashamed because Sudan was their hope and Egypt was their beauty.

18036.text: When that day comes, those who live on this coastland will say, ‘Look at what has happened to our hope. We ran to Egypt for help to be rescued from the king of Assyria. How can we escape?’”

18037.text: §¶This is the divine revelation about the desert by the sea.¶▼Like a storm sweeping through the Negev,/_an invader will come from the desert,/_from a terrifying land.

18038.text: /I was shown a harsh vision./_The traitor betrays./_The destroyer destroys./_Go to war, Elam!/_Surround them, Media!/_I will put an end to all the groaning.

18039.text: /That is why my body is full of trembling./_Pain grips me like the pain of childbirth./_I’m disturbed by what I hear./_I’m terrified by what I see.

18040.text: /I’m confused./_I’m shaking with terror./_The twilight hours I longed for make me tremble.

18041.text: /Set the table./_Spread the rugs by the table./_Eat. Drink./_Get up, you leaders!/_Prepare your shields for battle!

18042.text: ¶This is what Adonay says to me:¶▼Post a watchman./_Have him report whatever he sees.

18043.text: /He will see chariots, pairs of horsemen,/_riders on donkeys, and riders on camels./_Let him watch carefully, very carefully.

18044.text: /The watchman called,/_“Sir, I stand on the watchtower every day./_Every night, I stand guard at my post.

18045.text: /_Look! Here come chariots and horsemen in pairs.”/_Then he said,/_“Babylon has fallen! It has fallen!/_All the idols they worship lie shattered on the ground.”

18046.text: ¶You, my people, have been threshed and winnowed./_I make known to you what I heard from Yahweh Tsebaoth,/_the Elohim of Israel.

18047.text: §¶This is the divine revelation about Dumah.¶▼Someone is calling to me from Seir,/_“Watchman, how much of the night is left?/_Watchman, how much of the night is left?”

18048.text: /The watchman answers,/_“Morning is coming, and night will come again./_If you need to ask, come back and ask.”

18049.text: §¶This is the divine revelation about Arabia.¶▼You caravan of travelers from the people of Dedan/_will spend the night in the forest of Arabia.

18050.text: /Bring water for the thirsty,/_you inhabitants of the land of Tema./_Bring food to the fugitives.

18051.text: /They flee from swords,/_from swords ready to kill,/_from bows ready to shoot,/_and from the thick of battle.

18052.text: ¶This is what Adonay says to me: All of Kedar’s honor will be gone in another year. I will count it like workers count the years left on their contracts.

18053.text: The remaining number of archers, Kedar’s mighty archers, will be few. Yahweh Elohim of Israel has spoken.

18054.text: §¶This is the divine revelation about the valley of Vision.¶▼What’s the matter with you?/_Why do all of you go up on the roofs?

18055.text: /You are a city filled with shouting,/_a town filled with noise and excitement./_Your people weren’t killed with swords./_Your dead didn’t die in battle.

18056.text: /All your leaders fled together/_and were captured without their bows and arrows./_All those who were found were taken prisoner/_before any of them could get far away.

18057.text: /That is why I say,/_“Turn away from me/_so that I can cry bitterly./_Don’t try to comfort me/_because of the destruction brought on my people.”

18058.text: ¶Adonay Yahweh Tsebaoth has chosen a special day./_It will be a day of confusion and trampling/_in the valley of Vision,/_a day of tearing down walls and crying for help/_in the mountains.

18059.text: /Elam takes its quiver of arrows,/_manned chariots, and horsemen./_Kir uncovers its shields.

18060.text: /Then your fertile valleys will be filled with chariots,/_and horsemen will stand ready in front of the gate.

18061.text: /On that day Yahweh will remove the defenses of Judah.¶You will look for weapons in the House of the Forest.

18062.text: /You will see how many places in David’s wall are broken./_You will store water in the Lower Pool.

18063.text: /You will count the houses in Jerusalem./_You will tear down those houses in order to fortify the walls.

18064.text: /You will build a reservoir between the two walls/_to hold the water of the Old Pool./_You didn’t look to Jerusalem’s maker./_You didn’t see the one who formed it long ago.

18065.text: /On that day Adonay Yahweh Tsebaoth/_will call for crying and for mourning,/_for shaving your heads and for wearing sackcloth.

18066.text: /Instead, you will rejoice, celebrate,/_slaughter cattle, and butcher sheep./_You will eat meat, drink wine, and say,/_“Let’s eat and drink because tomorrow we’re going to die.”

18067.text: ¶Yahweh Tsebaoth revealed this to me: “Certainly, this wrong will not be forgiven even when you die,” says Adonay Yahweh Tsebaoth.

18068.text: §¶This is what Adonay Yahweh Tsebaoth says:¶▼Go to Shebna, the man in charge of the palace, and say to him,

18069.text: /“What are you doing here?/_What right do you have to dig a tomb for yourself?/_What right do you have to cut it out in a prominent place?/_What right do you have to carve out/_a resting place for yourself in the rock?

18070.text: /Look, mighty man!/_Yahweh will throw you out./_He will grab you.

18071.text: /He will wrap you up tightly like a turban./_He will throw you far away into another land./_There you will die./_There your splendid chariots will remain./_There you will become a disgrace to your master’s household.

18072.text: ¶“I will remove you from your office/_and do away with your position.

18073.text: /When that day comes, I will call my servant Eliakim, son of Hilkiah.

18074.text: /I will dress him in your linen robe/_and fasten it with your belt./_I will give him your authority,/_and he will be like a father to those who live in Jerusalem/_and to the nation of Judah.

18075.text: /I will place the key of the house of David around his neck./_What he opens no one will shut./_What he shuts no one will open.

18076.text: /I will fasten him firmly in place like a peg,/_and he will be a source of honor for his father’s household.

18077.text: /They will hang on him the whole weight of his father’s household,/_descendants and offspring and all the little utensils,/_from bowls to jars of every kind.”

18078.text: ¶Yahweh Tsebaoth declares,¶▼“On that day the peg which I firmly fastened in place will be removed./_It will be cut off and will fall,/_and everything hanging on it will be destroyed.”¶Yahweh has spoken.

18079.text: §¶This is the divine revelation about Tyre.¶▼Cry loudly, you ships of Tarshish!/_Your port at Tyre is destroyed./_Word has come to the ships from Cyprus.

18080.text: /Be silent, you inhabitants of the coastland, you merchants from Sidon./_Your messengers have crossed the sea.

18081.text: /The grain of Shihor is on the Mediterranean./_The harvest of the Nile River is brought to Tyre./_Tyre became the marketplace for the nations.

18082.text: ¶Be ashamed, Sidon, because the stronghold by the sea has spoken,/_“I’ve never been in labor or given birth./_I’ve raised no sons./_I’ve brought up no daughters.”

18083.text: /When the news reaches Egypt,/_the Egyptians will shudder over the news about Tyre.

18084.text: ¶Travel to Tarshish!/_Cry loudly, you inhabitants of the seacoast!

18085.text: /Is this your bustling city founded in the distant past?/_Is this the city that sent its people to settle in distant lands?

18086.text: /Who planned such a thing against Tyre, the city that produced kings?/_Its merchants are princes./_Its traders are among the honored people of the world.

18087.text: /Yahweh Tsebaoth planned this/_in order to dishonor all arrogant people/_and to humiliate all the honored people of the world.

18088.text: /Travel through your country like the Nile, people of Tarshish./_You no longer have a harbor.

18089.text: /Yahweh has stretched his hand over the sea to shake kingdoms./_He has commanded that Canaan’s fortifications be destroyed.

18090.text: /He says, “You will no longer be joyful,/_my dear abused people Sidon.”/_Get up, and travel to Cyprus./_Even there you will find no rest.

18091.text: /Look at the land of the Babylonians./_These people will be gone./_Assyria gave this land to the desert animals./_Assyria set up battle towers,/_stripped palaces bare,/_and turned these places into ruins.

18092.text: ¶Cry loudly, you ships of Tarshish, because your fortress will be destroyed.

18093.text: When that day comes, Tyre will be forgotten for 70 years, the lifetime of one king. At the end of the 70 years, Tyre will be like the prostitute in this song:

18094.text: ¶“Take your lyre./_Go around in the city, you forgotten prostitute./_Make sweet music./_Sing many songs so that you’ll be remembered.”

18095.text: ¶At the end of 70 years Yahweh will come to help Tyre. Then she will go back to earning money as a prostitute. She will become a prostitute for all the world’s kingdoms.

18096.text: Her profits and her earnings will be turned over to Yahweh for his holy purpose. It won’t be stored or hoarded. Her merchandise will belong to those who live in the presence of Yahweh so that they will have plenty of food and expensive clothing.

18097.text: §¶Yahweh is going to turn the earth into a desolate wasteland./_He will mar the face of the earth and scatter the people living on it.

18098.text: /The same will happen to people and priests,/_male slaves and masters,/_female slaves and masters,/_buyers and sellers,/_lenders and borrowers,/_debtors and creditors.

18099.text: /The earth will be completely laid waste and stripped/_because Yahweh has spoken.

18100.text: ¶The earth dries up and withers./_The world wastes away and withers./_The great leaders of the earth waste away.

18101.text: /The earth is polluted by those who live on it/_because they’ve disobeyed the Lord’s teachings,/_violated his laws,/_and rejected the everlasting promise.

18102.text: /That is why a curse devours the earth,/_and its people are punished for their guilt./_That is why those who live on the earth are burned up,/_and only a few people are left.

18103.text: /New wine dries up, and grapevines waste away./_All happy people groan.

18104.text: /Joyful tambourine music stops./_Noisy celebrations cease./_Joyful harp music stops.

18105.text: /People no longer drink wine when they sing./_Liquor tastes bad to its drinkers.

18106.text: /The ruined city lies desolate./_The entrance to every house is barred shut.

18107.text: /People in the streets call for wine./_All joy passes away,/_and the earth’s happiness is banished.

18108.text: /The city is left in ruins./_Its gate is battered to pieces.

18109.text: ¶That is the way it will be on earth among the nations./_They will be like an olive tree which has been shaken/_or like what’s left after the grape harvest.

18110.text: /They raise their voices./_They shout for joy./_From the sea they sing joyfully about Yahweh’s majesty.

18111.text: /Honor Yahweh in the east./_Honor the name of Yahweh Elohim of Israel along the coastlands.

18112.text: /From the ends of the earth we hear songs of praise/_that honor the Righteous One.¶But I kept saying,/_“I’m wasting away! I’m wasting away!/_How horrible it is for me!/_Traitors continue to betray,/_and their treachery grows worse and worse.”

18113.text: /Disasters, pits, and traps/_are in store for those who live on earth.

18114.text: /Whoever flees from news of a disaster will fall into a pit./_Whoever climbs out of that pit will be caught in a trap./_The floodgates in the sky will be opened,/_and the foundations of the earth will shake.

18115.text: /The earth will be completely broken./_The earth will shake back and forth violently./_The earth will stagger.

18116.text: /The earth will stumble like a drunk/_and sway like a shack in the wind./_Its disobedience weighs heavy on it./_It will fall and not get up again.

18117.text: ¶On that day Yahweh will punish heaven’s armies in heaven/_and earth’s kings on earth.

18118.text: /They’ll be gathered like prisoners in a jail/_and locked in prison./_After a long time they’ll be punished.

18119.text: /The moon will be embarrassed./_The sun will be ashamed,/_because Yahweh Tsebaoth will rule/_on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem./_He will be glorious/_in the presence of his respected leaders.

18120.text: §¶O Yahweh, you are my Elohim./_I will highly honor you; I will praise your name./_You have done miraculous things./_You have been completely reliable/_in carrying out your plans from long ago.

18121.text: /You have turned cities into ruins,/_fortified cities into piles of rubble,/_and foreigners’ palaces into cities that will never be rebuilt.

18122.text: /That is why strong people will honor you,/_and cities ruled by the world’s tyrants will fear you.

18123.text: /You have been a refuge for the poor,/_a refuge for the needy in their distress,/_a shelter from the rain, and shade from the heat./_(A tyrant’s breath is like a rainstorm against a wall,

18124.text: /like heat in a dry land.)/_You calm the uproar of foreigners./_The song of tyrants is silenced/_like heat that is reduced by the shadow of a cloud.

18125.text: §¶On this mountain Yahweh Tsebaoth will prepare for all people/_a feast with the best foods,/_a banquet with aged wines,/_with the best foods and the finest wines.

18126.text: /On this mountain he will remove/_the veil of grief covering all people/_and the mask covering all nations.

18127.text: /He will swallow up death forever./_Adonay Yahweh will wipe away tears from every face,/_and he will remove the disgrace of his people from the whole earth./_Yahweh has spoken.

18128.text: /On that day his people will say,/_“This is our Elohim; we have waited for him, and now he will save us./_This is Yahweh; we have waited for him./_Let us rejoice and be glad because he will save us.”

18129.text: ¶Yahweh’s power will be on this mountain./_Moab will be trampled beneath him/_like straw that is trampled in a pile of manure.

18130.text: /The Moabites will stretch out their hands in the manure/_like swimmers who stretch out their hands to swim./_The Lord will humble those arrogant people/_despite the movements of their hands.

18131.text: /He will bring down Moab’s high fortified walls,/_level them, and throw them into the dust on the ground.

18132.text: §¶On that day this song will be sung in the land of Judah:¶▼We have a strong city./_Its walls and fortifications provide safety.

18133.text: ¶Open the gates, and let the righteous nation come in,/_the nation that remains faithful.

18134.text: /With perfect peace you will protect those whose minds cannot be changed,/_because they trust you.

18135.text: /Trust Yahweh always,/_because Yah, Yahweh alone, is an everlasting rock.

18136.text: /He has brought down those who live high in the towering city./_He levels it./_He levels it to the ground and throws it into the dust.

18137.text: /Feet trample it,/_the feet of the oppressed,/_the footsteps of the poor.

18138.text: ¶The path of the righteous is level./_O Upright One, you make the road of the righteous smooth.

18139.text: /Certainly, we wait with hope for you, O Yahweh,/_as we follow the path of your guiding principles./_We want to remember you and your name.

18140.text: /With my soul I long for you at night./_Yes, with my spirit I eagerly look for you./_When your guiding principles are on earth,/_those who live in the world learn to do what is right.

18141.text: /Although the wicked are shown pity,/_they do not learn to do what is right./_They do what is wrong in the upright land/_and do not see the majesty of Yahweh.

18142.text: /O Yahweh, your power is visible, but they do not see it./_They will see how devoted your people are,/_and they will be put to shame./_Your burning anger will destroy your enemies.

18143.text: ¶O Yahweh, you will establish peace for us,/_since you have done everything for us.

18144.text: /O Yahweh, our Elohim, you are not the only master to rule us,/_but we acknowledge only you.

18145.text: /The wicked are dead./_They are no longer alive./_The spirits of the dead won’t rise./_You have punished them, destroyed them,/_and wiped out all memory of them.

18146.text: /You have expanded the nation, O Yahweh./_You have expanded the nation./_You are honored./_You have extended all the land’s boundaries.

18147.text: /O Yahweh, the people have come to you in trouble./_They were humbled by oppression, by your discipline upon them.

18148.text: /O Yahweh, when we are with you,/_we are like pregnant women ready to give birth./_They writhe and cry out in their labor pains.

18149.text: /We were pregnant; we writhed with labor pains/_only to give birth to the wind./_We weren’t able to bring salvation to the land,/_and no new people were born on earth.

18150.text: /Your dead will live./_Their corpses will rise./_Those who lie dead in the dust will wake up and shout for joy,/_because your dew is a refreshing dew,/_and the earth will revive the spirits of the dead.

18151.text: ¶My people, go to your rooms,/_and shut the doors behind you./_Hide for a little while until his fury has ended.

18152.text: /Yahweh is going to come out from his dwelling place/_to punish those who live on earth for their sins./_The earth will uncover the blood shed on it/_and will no longer cover up its dead bodies.

18153.text: §¶On that day Yahweh will use his fierce and powerful sword/_to punish Leviathan, that slippery snake,/_Leviathan, that twisting snake./_He will kill that monster which lives in the sea.

18154.text: ¶On that day sing about a delightful vineyard.

18155.text: /I, Yahweh, watch over it./_I water it continually./_I watch over it day and night/_so that no one will harm it.

18156.text: /I am no longer angry./_If only thorns and briars would confront me!/_I would fight them in battle and set all of them on fire.

18157.text: /Or else let them come to me for protection./_Let them make peace with me./_Yes, let them make peace with me.

18158.text: ¶In times to come Jacob will take root./_Israel will blossom, bud,/_and fill the whole world with fruit.

18159.text: ¶Will Yahweh hurt Israel as he hurt others who hurt them?/_Will he kill them as he killed others?

18160.text: /He punished Israel by sending it away./_He removed it with a fierce blast from the east winds.

18161.text: /In this way the wrongdoings of the descendants of Jacob are covered up./_This is the way they will turn from their sins—/_when they turn all the altar stones into powdered chalk/_and no poles dedicated to the goddess Asherah/_or incense altars are left standing.

18162.text: /The fortified city is isolated./_The homestead is left deserted, abandoned like the desert./_Calves will graze there./_They will lie down./_They will feed on the branches.

18163.text: /When the branches are dried up,/_they will be broken off./_Women will come and build a fire with them./_These people don’t understand these things./_That is why their maker won’t have compassion on them,/_and their Creator won’t have pity on them.

18164.text: ¶On that day Yahweh will begin his threshing/_from the flowing stream of the Euphrates River/_to the brook of Egypt./_People of Israel, you will be gathered one by one.

18165.text: ¶On that day a ram’s horn will be blown loudly./_Those who are dying in Assyria/_and those who are banished to Egypt/_will come and worship Yahweh/_on the holy mountain in Jerusalem.

18166.text: §¶How horrible it will be for the arrogant drunks of Ephraim./_Their glorious beauty is like a withered flower./_They are at the entrance to a fertile valley/_where they lie drunk from wine.

18167.text: /Adonay has one who is strong and powerful./_He is like a hailstorm, a destructive wind./_He is like a thunderstorm, an overwhelming flood./_He will throw them to the ground forcefully.

18168.text: /The arrogant drunks of Ephraim will be trampled underfoot.

18169.text: /Their glorious beauty is like a withered flower./_They are at the entrance to a fertile valley./_They will be like figs that ripened early./_As soon as someone sees them,/_they will be taken and eaten.

18170.text: ¶When that day comes, Yahweh Tsebaoth will be/_like a glorious crown for his few remaining people.

18171.text: /He will give a spirit of justice to those who judge./_He will give strength to those who defend the city gates in battle.

18172.text: ¶Priests and prophets stagger from wine and wobble from too much liquor./_They stagger from too much liquor/_and become confused from too much wine./_They wobble because of their liquor./_They stagger when they see visions./_They swerve as they judge.

18173.text: /All the tables are covered with vomit and excrement./_There isn’t a clean place left.

18174.text: /To whom will they make the message understood?/_To whom will they explain this message?/_To children just weaned from milk?/_To those just taken from their mother’s breasts?

18176.text: ¶Yahweh will speak to these people./_He will mock them by speaking in a foreign language.

18177.text: /He will say to them,/_“This is a place for comfort./_This is a place of rest for those who are tired./_This is a place for them to rest.”/_But they weren’t willing to listen.

18178.text: /Yahweh speaks utter nonsense to them./_That is why they will fall backwards./_That is why they will be hurt, trapped, and captured.

18179.text: §¶So hear the word of Yahweh, you foolish talkers/_who rule the people in Jerusalem.

18180.text: /You say, “We made a treaty with death/_and an agreement with the grave./_When the overwhelming disaster passes by,/_it won’t matter to us,/_because we have taken refuge in our lies,/_and falsehood is our hiding place.”

18181.text: ¶This is what Adonay Yahweh says:¶▼I am going to lay a rock in Zion,/_a rock that has been tested,/_a precious cornerstone,/_a solid foundation./_Whoever believes in him will not worry.

18182.text: /I will make justice a measuring line/_and righteousness a plumb line./_Hail will sweep away your refuge of lies,/_and floodwaters will wash away your hiding place.

18183.text: /Your treaty with death will be wiped away./_Your agreement with the grave will not stand./_When the overwhelming disaster passes by,/_you will be trampled by it.

18184.text: /Each time it passes by it will take you./_It will pass by morning after morning,/_during the day and during the night./_Understanding this message brings only terror.

18185.text: /The bed is too short to stretch out on./_The blanket is too narrow to serve as a cover.

18186.text: /Yahweh will rise as he did on Mount Perazim./_He will wake up as he did in Gibeon Valley./_He will do his work, his unexpected work,/_and perform his deeds, his mysterious deeds.

18187.text: /Now stop laughing, or your chains will be tightened,/_because I have heard that Adonay Yahweh Tsebaoth/_has finally determined to destroy the whole land.

18188.text: ¶Open your ears, and listen to me!/_Pay attention, and hear me!

18189.text: /Does a farmer go on plowing every day so he can plant?/_Does he continue to break up the soil and make furrows in the ground?
