18190.text: /When he has smoothed its surface,/_doesn’t he scatter black cumin seed and plant cumin?/_Doesn’t he plant wild wheat in rows?/_Doesn’t he put barley in its own area/_and winter wheat at its borders?

18191.text: /Yahweh will guide him in judgment,/_and his Elohim will teach him.

18192.text: ¶Black cumin isn’t threshed with a sledge,/_and wagon wheels aren’t rolled over cumin./_Black cumin is beaten with a rod/_and cumin with a stick.

18193.text: /Grain is ground into flour, but the grinding eventually stops./_It will be threshed./_The wheels of his cart will roll over it,/_but his horses won’t crush it.

18194.text: /All of this has come from Yahweh Tsebaoth./_His counsel is wonderful, and his wisdom is great.

18195.text: §¶How horrible it will be for you Ariel, Ariel,/_the city where David camped./_Let year after year go by./_Let your annual festivals go on.

18196.text: /I will torment Ariel,/_and the city will be filled with people grieving and mourning./_The city will become like Ariel.

18197.text: /I will set up war camps all around you./_I will blockade you with towers./_I will put up mounds of dirt around you.

18198.text: /When you have fallen, you will speak as you lie on the ground./_Your words will be muffled by the dust./_Your voice will come out of the ground like that of a ghost./_Your words will be whispered from the dust.

18199.text: /Your many enemies will be like fine dust./_Your many foes will be like husks blown by the wind./_All of this will happen suddenly, unexpectedly.

18200.text: /Yahweh Tsebaoth will punish you/_with thunder, earthquakes, and loud noises,/_with windstorms, rainstorms, and fire storms.

18201.text: /The armies from all the nations will go to war against Ariel./_They will go to war against it, blockade it, and torment it./_All of this will be like a dream, like a vision in the night.

18202.text: /They will be like hungry people who dream that they’re eating/_and wake up to find they’re hungry./_They will be like thirsty people who dream that they’re drinking/_and wake up to find they’re lightheaded and parched with thirst./_This is what will happen to the armies from all the nations/_that fight against Mount Zion.

18203.text: ¶If you confuse yourselves, you will be confused./_If you blind yourselves, you will be blinded./_You are drunk, but not from wine./_You stagger, but not from liquor.

18204.text: /Yahweh has poured out on you a spirit of deep sleep./_He will shut your eyes. (Your eyes are the prophets.)/_He will cover your heads. (Your heads are the seers.)

18205.text: ¶To you all these visions will be like words in a book that is closed and sealed. You give this book to someone who can read, saying, “Please read this.”¶He answers, “I can’t read it. It’s sealed.”

18206.text: ¶Then you give the book to someone who can’t read, saying, “Please read this.”¶He answers, “I can’t read.”

18207.text: ¶Adonay says,¶▼“These people worship me with their mouths/_and honor me with their lips./_But their hearts are far from me,/_and their worship of me is based on rules made by humans.

18208.text: /That is why I am going to do something completely amazing/_for these people once again./_The wisdom of their wise people will disappear./_The intelligence of their intelligent people will be hidden.”

18209.text: ¶How horrible it will be for those/_who try to hide their plans from Yahweh./_Their deeds are done in the dark,/_and they say, “No one can see us”/_and “No one can recognize us.”

18210.text: /You turn things upside down!/_Is the potter no better than his clay?/_Can something that has been made/_say about its maker, “He didn’t make me”?/_Can a piece of pottery/_say about the potter, “He doesn’t understand”?

18211.text: /In a very short time Lebanon will be turned into a fertile field/_and the fertile field will be considered a forest.

18212.text: /When that day comes, the deaf will hear the words written in the book./_The blind will see out of their gloom and darkness.

18213.text: /Humble people again will find joy in Yahweh./_The poorest of people will find joy in Qedosh Yisrael.

18214.text: /Tyrants will be gone./_Mockers will be finished./_All who look for ways to do wrong will come to an end:

18215.text: /those who make people sin with words,/_those who lay traps for judges,/_those who, without any reason, deny justice/_to people who are in the right.

18216.text: ¶This is what Yahweh, who saved Abraham, says about the descendants of Jacob:¶▼Jacob will no longer be ashamed./_Jacob’s face will no longer turn pale.

18217.text: /When they see all their children,/_the children I made with my hands,/_they will acknowledge my name as holy./_They will treat the Holy One of Jacob as holy./_They will stand in terror of the Elohim of Israel.

18218.text: /Then those who are wayward in spirit will gain understanding,/_and those who complain will accept instruction.

18219.text: §¶Yahweh declares,¶▼“How horrible it will be for those rebellious children./_They carry out plans, but not mine./_They make alliances against my will./_They pile sin on top of sin.

18220.text: /They go to Egypt without asking me./_They look for shelter under Pharaoh’s protection/_and look for refuge in Egypt’s shadow.

18221.text: /But Pharaoh’s protection will be their shame,/_and the refuge in Egypt’s shadow will be their disgrace.

18222.text: /Although Pharaoh’s officials are in Zoan/_and his messengers have reached Hanes,

18223.text: /_the people of Judah will be put to shame/_because that nation can’t help them./_That nation can’t give aid or help to them./_It can only offer shame and disgrace.”

18224.text: ¶This is the divine revelation about the animals in the Negev.¶▼“My people travel through lands/_where they experience distress and hardship./_Lions and lionesses live there./_Vipers and poisonous snakes live there./_They carry their riches on the backs of young donkeys/_and their treasures on the humps of camels/_to a nation that can’t help them.

18225.text: /Egypt’s help is completely useless./_That is why I call it, ‘Rahab who sits still.’

18226.text: /Now, write this on a tablet for them, and inscribe it in a book/_so that it will be there in the future as a permanent witness.

18227.text: /These people are rebellious and deceitful children,/_children who refuse to listen to Yahweh’s teachings.

18228.text: /They say to the seers, ‘Don’t see the future.’/_They say to those who have visions,/_‘Don’t have visions that tell us what is right./_Tell us what we want to hear. See illusions.

18229.text: /Get out of our way! Stop blocking our path!/_Get Qedosh Yisrael out of our sight.’”

18230.text: ¶This is what Qedosh Yisrael says:¶▼You have rejected this warning,/_trusted oppression and deceit,/_and leaned on them.

18231.text: /That is why your sin will be/_like a high wall with a bulging crack, ready to fall./_All of a sudden it will fall.

18232.text: /It will break like pottery./_It will be smashed, and nothing will be left of it./_No piece will be big enough to carry live coals from a fireplace/_or to dip water from a reservoir.

18233.text: ¶This is what Adonay Yahweh, Qedosh Yisrael, says:¶▼You can be saved by returning to me./_You can have rest./_You can be strong by being quiet and by trusting me./_But you don’t want that.

18234.text: /You’ve said, “No, we’ll flee on horses.”/_So you flee./_You’ve added, “We’ll ride on fast horses.”/_So those who chase you will also be fast.

18235.text: /One thousand people will flee when one person threatens them,/_and you will flee when five threaten you./_Then you will be left alone/_like a flagpole on top of a mountain,/_like a signpost on a hill.

18236.text: /Yahweh is waiting to be kind to you./_He rises to have compassion on you./_Yahweh is an Elohim of justice./_Blessed are all those who wait for him.

18237.text: §¶You will live in Zion, in Jerusalem. You won’t cry anymore. Yahweh will certainly have pity on you when you cry for help. As soon as he hears you, he will answer you.

18238.text: Adonay may give you troubles and hardships. But your teacher will no longer be hidden from you. You will see your teacher with your own eyes.

18239.text: You will hear a voice behind you saying, “This is the way. Follow it, whether it turns to the right or to the left.”

18240.text: Then you will dishonor your silver-plated idols and your gold-covered statues. You will throw them away like clothing ruined by stains. You will say to them, “Get out!”

18241.text: ¶Adonay will give you rain for the seed that you plant in the ground, and the food that the ground provides will be rich and nourishing. When that day comes, your cattle will graze in large pastures.

18242.text: The oxen and the donkeys which work the soil will eat a mixture of food that has been winnowed with forks and shovels.

18243.text: There will be brooks and streams on every lofty mountain and every high hill. When the day of the great slaughter comes, towers will fall.

18244.text: Then the light of the moon will be like the light of the sun. The light of the sun will be seven times as strong, like the light of seven days. When that day comes, Yahweh will bandage his people’s injuries and heal the wounds he inflicted.

18245.text: ¶The name of Yahweh is going to come from far away./_His anger is burning./_His burden is heavy./_His lips are filled with fury./_His tongue is like a devouring flame.

18246.text: /His breath is like an overflowing stream./_It rises neck high,/_sifting the nations with a sieve of destruction,/_placing a bit in the mouths of the people/_to lead them astray.

18247.text: /You will sing a song/_like the song you sing on a festival night./_Your hearts will be happy like someone going out with a flute/_on the way to Yahweh’s mountain, to the rock of Israel.

18248.text: /Yahweh will make his majestic voice heard./_He will come down with all his might,/_with furious anger,/_with fire storms, windstorms, rainstorms, and hailstones.

18249.text: /At the sound of Yahweh, the people of Assyria will be shattered./_He will strike them with his rod.

18250.text: /To the sound of tambourines and lyres, Yahweh will pound on them./_He will fight them in battle, swinging his fists.

18251.text: /Topheth was prepared long ago./_It was made ready for the king./_It was made deep and wide and piled high with plenty of burning logs./_Yahweh’s breath will be like a flood of burning sulfur,/_setting it on fire.

18252.text: §¶How horrible it will be for those/_who go to Egypt for help,/_who rely on horses,/_who depend on many chariots,/_who depend on very strong war horses./_They don’t look to Qedosh Yisrael./_They don’t seek Yahweh.

18253.text: /_He is wise and can bring about disaster./_He doesn’t take back his words./_He rises against wicked people/_and against those who help troublemakers.

18254.text: /The Egyptians are humans, not gods./_Their horses are flesh and blood, not spirit./_When Yahweh uses his powerful hand,/_the one who gives help will stumble,/_and the one who receives help will fall./_Both will die together.

18255.text: ¶This is what Yahweh said to me:¶▼A lion, even a young lion, growls over its prey/_when a crowd of shepherds is called to fight it./_It isn’t frightened by their voices/_or disturbed by the noise they make./_So Yahweh Tsebaoth will come to fight for/_Mount Zion and its hill.

18256.text: /Yahweh Tsebaoth will defend Jerusalem like a hovering bird./_He will defend it and rescue it./_He will pass over it and protect it.

18257.text: /You people of Israel, return to the one/_whom you have so violently rebelled against.

18258.text: /When that day comes, all of you will reject/_the silver and gold idols/_that your sinful hands have made.

18259.text: /Then Assyrians will be killed with swords not made by human hands./_Swords not made by human hands will destroy them./_They will flee from battle,/_and their young men will be made to do forced labor.

18260.text: /In terror they will run to their stronghold,/_and their officers will be frightened at the sight of the battle flag.¶►Yahweh declares this. His fire is in Zion and his furnace is in Jerusalem.

18261.text: §¶A king will rule with fairness,/_and officials will rule with justice.

18262.text: /Then each ruler will be like a shelter from the wind/_and a hiding place from the rain./_They will be like streams on parched ground/_and the shade of a large rock in a weary land.

18263.text: /Then the vision of those who can see won’t be blurred,/_and the ears of those who can hear will pay attention.

18264.text: /Then those who are reckless will begin to understand,/_and those who stutter will speak quickly and clearly.

18265.text: /Godless fools will no longer be called nobles,/_nor will scoundrels be considered gentlemen.

18266.text: /Godless fools speak foolishness,/_and their minds plan evil/_in order to do ungodly things./_They speak falsely about Yahweh./_They let people go hungry/_and withhold water from thirsty people.

18267.text: /The tricks of scoundrels are evil./_They devise wicked plans in order to ruin poor people with lies,/_even when needy people plead for justice.

18268.text: /But honorable people act honorably/_and stand firm for what is honorable.

18269.text: ¶Get up, and listen to me, you pampered women./_Hear what I say, you overconfident daughters.

18270.text: /In a little less than a year/_you overconfident women will tremble,/_because the grape harvest will fail/_and no fruit will be brought in from the fields.

18271.text: /Shudder, you pampered women./_Tremble, you overconfident women./_Take off your clothes, walk around naked,/_and wear sackcloth around your waists.

18272.text: /Beat your breasts as you mourn for the fields,/_for the vines bearing grapes.

18273.text: /Mourn for my people’s land where thorns and briars will grow./_Mourn for all the happy homes in a joyful city.

18274.text: /Palaces will be deserted./_Noisy cities will be abandoned./_Fortresses and watchtowers will become permanent caves./_They will be a delight for wild donkeys and pastures for flocks

18275.text: /until the Ruach is poured on us from on high./_Then the wilderness will be turned into a fertile field,/_and the fertile field will be considered a forest.

18276.text: /Then justice will live in the wilderness,/_and righteousness will be at home in the fertile field.

18277.text: /Then an act of righteousness will bring about peace,/_calm, and safety forever.

18278.text: /My people will live in a peaceful place,/_in safe homes and quiet places of rest.

18279.text: /The forest will be flattened because of hail,/_and the city will be completely leveled.

18280.text: /Blessed are those who plant beside every stream/_and those who let oxen and donkeys roam freely.

18281.text: §¶How horrible it will be for you, you destroyer,/_although you haven’t been destroyed./_How horrible it will be for you, you traitor,/_although you haven’t been betrayed./_When you’ve finished destroying, you will be destroyed./_When you’ve finished being a traitor, you will be betrayed.

18282.text: ¶O Yahweh, have pity on us./_We wait with hope for you./_Be our strength in the morning./_Yes, be our savior in times of trouble.

18283.text: /People flee from the noise of your army./_Nations scatter when you attack.

18284.text: /You nations, your loot is gathered as grasshoppers harvest a crop./_Like swarming locusts, people rush for your loot.

18285.text: ¶Yahweh is honored because he lives on high./_He will fill Zion with justice and righteousness.

18286.text: /He will be the foundation of your future./_The riches of salvation are wisdom and knowledge./_The fear of Yahweh is your treasure.

18287.text: ¶Heroes cry in the streets./_Messengers of peace cry bitterly.

18288.text: /Highways are deserted./_Travelers stop traveling./_Agreements are broken./_Witnesses are rejected./_People are no longer respected.

18289.text: /The country grieves and wastes away./_Lebanon is ashamed and is decaying./_Sharon has become like a wilderness./_Bashan and Carmel are shaken.

18290.text: ¶Yahweh says, “Now I will arise./_Now I will get up./_Now I will be lifted up.”

18291.text: /You will be pregnant with hay./_You will give birth to straw./_Your breath will be a fire which will burn you up.

18292.text: /People will be cremated./_They will be set on fire like dry thornbushes.

18293.text: ¶Hear what I have done, you people who are far away!/_Acknowledge my might, you people who are near!

18294.text: /The sinners in Zion are terrified./_Trembling seizes the ungodly./_Can any of us live through a fire that destroys?/_Can any of us live through a fire that burns forever?

18295.text: /The person who does what is right and speaks the truth will live./_He rejects getting rich by extortion and refuses to take bribes./_He refuses to listen to those who are plotting murders./_He doesn’t look for evil things to do.

18296.text: /This person will live on high./_His stronghold will be a fortress made of rock./_He will have plenty of food/_and a dependable supply of water.

18297.text: ¶Your eyes will see how handsome the king is./_You will see a land that stretches into the distance.

18298.text: /Your mind will be thinking of the terrors in the past./_Where are the scribes?/_Where are the tax collectors?/_Where are those who counted the towers?

18299.text: /You will no longer see those savage people,/_those people with an unrecognizable language,/_with a foreign language that you can’t understand.

18300.text: /Look at Zion, the city of our festivals./_Your eyes will see Jerusalem as a peaceful place./_It is a tent that can’t be moved./_Its tent pegs will never be pulled out,/_and none of its ropes will be broken.

18301.text: /Yahweh will be our mighty defender/_in a place surrounded by wide rivers and streams./_Ships with oars won’t travel on them./_Stately ships won’t sail on them.

18302.text: /Yahweh is our Shophet./_Yahweh is our lawgiver./_Yahweh is our Melek./_Yahweh is our savior.

18303.text: ¶Your ropes hang loose,/_your mast isn’t secure,/_and your sail isn’t spread out./_A large amount of loot will be distributed./_Lame people will carry off your loot.

18304.text: /No one who lives in Zion will say, “I’m sick.”/_The sins of its inhabitants will be forgiven.

18305.text: §¶Come close, you nations, and listen./_Pay attention, you people./_The earth, everyone in it,/_the world, and everything on it will listen.

18306.text: /Yahweh is angry with all the nations./_He is furious with all their armies./_He has claimed them for destruction./_He has handed them over to be slaughtered.

18307.text: /_Their dead bodies will be thrown out./_A stench will rise from their corpses./_Mountains will be red with their blood.

18308.text: /All the stars in the sky will rot./_The heavens will be rolled up like a scroll./_The stars will fall/_like leaves from a grapevine,/_like green figs from a fig tree.

18309.text: /When my sword is covered with blood in the heavens,/_it will fall on Edom/_and on the people I’ve claimed for destruction.

18310.text: /Yahweh’s sword is covered with blood./_It is covered with fat,/_with the blood of lambs and goats,/_with the fat of rams’ kidneys./_Yahweh will receive a sacrifice in Bozrah,/_a huge slaughter in the land of Edom.

18311.text: /Wild oxen will be killed with them,/_young bulls along with rams./_Their land will be drenched with blood./_Their dust will be covered with fat.

18312.text: ¶Yahweh will have a day of vengeance,/_a year of revenge in defense of Zion.

18313.text: /Edom’s streams will be turned to tar./_Its soil will be turned to burning sulfur./_Its land will become blazing tar.

18314.text: /They will not be extinguished day or night,/_and smoke will always go up from them./_Edom will lie in ruins for generations./_No one will ever travel through it.

18315.text: /Pelicans and herons will take possession of the land./_Owls and crows will live there./_He will stretch the measuring line of chaos/_and the plumb line of destruction over it.

18316.text: /There are no nobles to rule a kingdom./_All of its princes have disappeared.

18317.text: /Its palaces are covered with thorns./_Its fortresses have nettles and thistles./_It will become a home for jackals/_and a place for ostriches.

18318.text: /Hyenas will meet with jackals./_Male goats will call to their mates./_Screech owls will rest there/_and find a resting place for themselves.

18319.text: /Owls will make their nests there, lay eggs, and hatch them./_They will gather their young/_in the shadow of their wings./_Vultures also will gather there,/_each one with its mate.

18320.text: ¶Search Yahweh’s book, and read it./_Not one of these animals will be missing./_Not one will lack a mate,/_because Yahweh has commanded it,/_and his Ruach will gather them together.

18321.text: /He is the one who throws dice for them,/_and his hand divides up the land for them with a measuring line./_They will possess it permanently/_and live there for generations.

18322.text: §¶The desert and the dry land will be glad,/_and the wilderness will rejoice and blossom.

18323.text: /Like a lily the land will blossom./_It will rejoice and sing with joy./_It will have the glory of Lebanon, the majesty of Carmel and Sharon./_Everyone will see the glory of Yahweh, the majesty of our Elohim.

18325.text: /Tell those who are terrified,/_“Be brave; don’t be afraid./_Your Elohim will come with vengeance, with divine revenge./_He will come and rescue you.”

18326.text: ¶Then the eyes of the blind will be opened,/_and the ears of the deaf will be unplugged.

18327.text: /Then those who are lame will leap like deer,/_and those who cannot speak will shout for joy./_Water will gush out into the desert,/_and streams will gush out into the wilderness.

18328.text: /Then the hot sand will become a pool,/_and dry ground will have springs./_Grass will become cattails and rushes/_in the home of jackals.

18329.text: /A highway will be there, a roadway./_It will be called the Holy Road./_Sinners won’t travel on it./_It will be for those who walk on it./_Godless fools won’t wander onto it.

18330.text: /_Lions won’t be there./_Wild animals won’t go on it./_They won’t be found there./_But the people reclaimed by the Lord will walk on it.

18331.text: /The people ransomed by Yahweh will return./_They will come to Zion singing with joy./_Everlasting happiness will be on their heads as a crown./_They will be glad and joyful./_They will have no sorrow or grief.

18332.text: §¶In Hezekiah’s fourteenth year as king, King Sennacherib of Assyria attacked all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.

18333.text: Then the king of Assyria sent his field commander with a large army from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem. He stood at the channel for the Upper Pool on the road to Laundryman’s Field.

18334.text: ¶Eliakim, who was in charge of the palace and was the son of Hilkiah, Shebna the scribe, and Joah, who was the royal historian and the son of Asaph, went out to the field commander.

18335.text: The field commander said to them, “Tell Hezekiah, ‘This is what the great king, the king of Assyria, says: What makes you so confident?

18336.text: You give useless advice about getting ready for war. Whom, then, do you trust for support in your rebellion against me?

18337.text: Look! When you trust Egypt, you’re trusting a broken stick for a staff. If you lean on it, it stabs your hand and goes through it. This is what Pharaoh (the king of Egypt) is like for everyone who trusts him.

18338.text: Suppose you tell me, “We’re trusting Yahweh our Elohim.” He’s the god whose places of worship and altars Hezekiah got rid of. Hezekiah told Judah and Jerusalem, “Worship at this altar.”’

18339.text: ¶“Now, make a deal with my master, the king of Assyria. I’ll give you 2,000 horses if you can put riders on them.

18340.text: How can you defeat my master’s lowest-ranking officers when you trust Egypt for chariots and horses?

18341.text: ¶“Have I come to destroy this country without Yahweh on my side? Yahweh said to me, ‘Attack this country, and destroy it.’”

18342.text: ¶Then Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah said to the field commander, “Speak to us in Aramaic, since we understand it. Don’t speak to us in the Judean language as long as there are people on the wall listening.”

18343.text: ¶But the field commander asked, “Did my master send me to tell these things only to you and your master? Didn’t he send me to the men sitting on the wall who will have to eat their own excrement and drink their own urine with you?”

18344.text: ¶Then the field commander stood and shouted loudly in the Judean language, “Listen to the great king, the king of Assyria.

18345.text: This is what the king says: Don’t let Hezekiah deceive you. He can’t rescue you.

18346.text: Don’t let Hezekiah get you to trust Yahweh by saying, ‘Yahweh will certainly rescue us, and this city will not be put under the control of the king of Assyria.’

18347.text: Don’t listen to Hezekiah, because this is what the king of Assyria says: Make peace with me! Come out, and give yourselves up to me! Everyone will eat from his own grapevine and fig tree and drink from his own cistern.

18348.text: Then I will come and take you away to a country like your own. It’s a country with grain and new wine, a country with bread and vineyards.

18349.text: Don’t let Hezekiah mislead you by saying to you, ‘Yahweh will rescue us.’ Did any of the gods of the nations rescue their countries from the king of Assyria?

18350.text: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Did they rescue Samaria from my control?

18351.text: Did the gods of these countries rescue them from my control? Could Yahweh then rescue Jerusalem from my control?”

18352.text: ¶They were silent and didn’t say anything to him because the king commanded them not to answer him.

18353.text: ¶Then Eliakim, who was in charge of the palace and was son of Hilkiah, Shebna the scribe, and Joah, who was the royal historian and the son of Asaph, went to Hezekiah with their clothes torn in grief. They told him the message from the field commander.

18354.text: ¶When King Hezekiah heard the message, he tore his clothes in grief, covered himself with sackcloth, and went into Yahweh’s temple.

18355.text: Then he sent Eliakim, who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the scribe, and the leaders of the priests, clothed in sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah, son of Amoz.

18356.text: ¶They said to him, “This is what Hezekiah says: Today is a day filled with misery, punishment, and disgrace. We are like a woman who is about to give birth but doesn’t have the strength to do it.

18357.text: Yahweh your Elohim may have heard the words of the field commander. His master, the king of Assyria, sent him to defy Elohim Chay. Yahweh your Elohim may punish him because of the message that Yahweh your Elohim heard. Pray for the few people who are left.”

18358.text: ¶So King Hezekiah’s men went to Isaiah.

18359.text: Isaiah answered them, “Say this to your master, ‘This is what Yahweh says: Don’t be afraid of the message that you heard when the Assyrian king’s assistants slandered me.

18360.text: I’m going to put a spirit in him so that he will hear a rumor and return to his own country. I’ll have him assassinated in his own country.’”

18361.text: ¶The field commander returned and found the king of Assyria fighting against Libnah. He had heard that the king left Lachish.

18362.text: Now, Sennacherib heard that King Tirhakah of Sudan was coming to fight him.¶When he heard this, he again sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,

18363.text: “Tell King Hezekiah of Judah, ‘Don’t let the god whom you trust deceive you by saying that Jerusalem will not be put under the control of the king of Assyria.

18364.text: You heard what the kings of Assyria did to all countries, how they totally destroyed them. Will you be rescued?

18365.text: Did the gods of the nations which my ancestors destroyed rescue Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the people of Eden who were in Telassar?

18366.text: Where is the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, and the king of the cities of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah?’”

18367.text: ¶Hezekiah took the letter from the messengers, read it, and went to Yahweh’s temple. He spread it out in front of Yahweh

18369.text: “Yahweh Tsebaoth, Elohim of Israel, you are enthroned over the angels. You alone are Elohim of the kingdoms of the world. You made heaven and earth.

18370.text: Turn your ear toward me, Yahweh, and listen. Open your eyes, Yahweh, and see. Listen to the entire message that Sennacherib sent to defy Elohim Chay.

18371.text: It is true, Yahweh, that the kings of Assyria have leveled every country.

18372.text: They have thrown the gods from these countries into fires because these gods aren’t real gods. They’re only wooden and stone statues made by human hands. So the Assyrians have destroyed them.

18373.text: Now, Yahweh our Elohim, rescue us from Assyria’s control so that all the kingdoms on earth will know that you alone are Yahweh.”

18374.text: §¶Then Isaiah, son of Amoz, sent a message to Hezekiah, “This is what Yahweh Elohim of Israel says: You prayed to me about King Sennacherib of Assyria.

18375.text: This is the message that Yahweh speaks to him,¶▼‘My dear people in Zion despise you and laugh at you./_My people in Jerusalem shake their heads behind your back.

18376.text: /Whom are you defying and slandering?/_Against whom are you shouting?/_Who are you looking at so arrogantly?/_It is Qedosh Yisrael!

18377.text: /Through your servants you defy Adonay and say,/_“With my many chariots I’ll ride up the high mountains,/_up the slopes of Lebanon./_I’ll cut down its tallest cedars and its finest cypresses./_I’ll come to its most distant heights/_and its most fertile forests.

18378.text: /I’ll dig wells and drink water./_I’ll dry up all the streams of Egypt/_with the trampling of my feet.”

18379.text: ¶“‘Haven’t you heard? I did this long ago./_I planned it in the distant past./_Now I make it happen so that you will turn fortified cities/_into piles of rubble.

18380.text: /Those who live in these cities are weak, discouraged, and ashamed./_They will be like plants in the field,/_like fresh, green grass on the roofs,/_dried up by the east wind.

18381.text: /I know when you get up and sit down,/_when you go out and come in,/_and how you rage against me.

18382.text: /Since you rage against me and your boasting has reached my ears,/_I will put my hook in your nose/_and my bridle in your mouth./_I will make you go back the way you came.

18383.text: ¶“‘And this will be a sign for you, Hezekiah: You will eat what grows by itself this year, and the next year you will eat what comes up by itself. But in the third year you will plant and harvest, plant vineyards, and eat what is produced.

18384.text: Those few people from the nation of Judah who escape will again take root and produce crops.

18385.text: Those few people will go out from Jerusalem, and those who escape will go out from Mount Zion. Yahweh Tsebaoth is determined to do this.’

18386.text: ¶“This is what Yahweh says about the king of Assyria:¶▼He will never come into this city,/_shoot an arrow here,/_hold a shield in front of it,/_or put up dirt ramps to attack it.

18387.text: /He will go back the way he came,/_and he won’t come into this city,”/_declares Yahweh Tsebaoth.

18388.text: /“I will shield this city to rescue it for my sake/_and for the sake of my servant David.”

18389.text: ¶Yahweh’s angel went out and killed 185,000 soldiers in the Assyrian camp. When the Judeans got up early in the morning, they saw all the corpses.

18390.text: ¶Then King Sennacherib of Assyria left. He went home to Nineveh and stayed there.

18391.text: While he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, Adrammelech and Sharezer, his sons, assassinated him and escaped to the land of Ararat. His son Esarhaddon succeeded him as king.

18392.text: §¶In those days Hezekiah became sick and was about to die. The prophet Isaiah, son of Amoz, came to him and said, “This is what Yahweh says: Give final instructions to your household, because you’re about to die. You won’t get well.”

18393.text: ¶Hezekiah turned to the wall and prayed to Yahweh.

18394.text: “Please, Yahweh, remember how I’ve lived faithfully and sincerely in your presence. I’ve done what you consider right.” And he cried bitterly.

18395.text: ¶Then Yahweh spoke his word to Isaiah,

18396.text: “Go and say to Hezekiah, ‘This is what Yahweh Elohim of your ancestor David says: I’ve heard your prayer. I’ve seen your tears. I’m going to give you 15 more years to live.

18397.text: I’ll rescue you and defend this city from the control of the king of Assyria.’”

18412.text: ¶Then Isaiah said, “Take a fig cake, and place it over the boil so that the king will get well.”

18413.text: ¶Hezekiah asked, “What is the sign that I’ll go to Yahweh’s temple?”

18398.text: ¶Isaiah said, “This is your sign from Yahweh that he will do what he promises.

18399.text: The sun made a shadow that went down the stairway of Ahaz’s upper palace. I’m going to make the shadow go back ten steps.” So the sun on the stairway went back up the ten steps it had gone down.

18400.text: ¶King Hezekiah of Judah wrote this after he was sick and became well again:

18401.text: ¶I thought that in the prime of my life/_I would go down to the gates of Sheol/_and be robbed of the rest of my life.

18402.text: /I thought that I wouldn’t see Yah in this world./_Even with all the people in the world,/_I thought I would never see another person.

18403.text: /My life was over./_You rolled it up like a shepherd’s tent./_You rolled up my life like a weaver./_You cut me off from the loom./_You ended my life in one day.

18404.text: /I cried out until morning/_as if a lion had crushed all my bones./_You ended my life in one day.

18405.text: /I chirped like swallows and cranes./_I cooed like doves./_My eyes were tired from looking up to heaven./_I’ve suffered miserably, O Adonay!/_Please help me!

18406.text: ¶What can I say now that he has spoken to me?/_He has done this./_I will be careful the rest of my life because of my bitter experience.

18407.text: /Adonay, people live in spite of such things,/_and I have the will to live in spite of them./_You give me health and keep me alive.

18408.text: /Now my bitter experience turns into peace./_You have saved me and kept me from the rotting pit./_You have thrown all my sins behind you.

18409.text: /Sheol doesn’t thank you!/_Death doesn’t praise you!/_Those who go down to the pit cannot expect you to be faithful.

18410.text: /Those who are living praise you as I do today./_Fathers make your faithfulness known to their children.

18411.text: /Yahweh is going to rescue me,/_so let us play stringed instruments./_We live our lives in Yahweh’s temple.

18414.text: §¶At that time Baladan’s son, King Merodach Baladan of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah. He had heard that Hezekiah had been sick and had recovered.

18415.text: Hezekiah was so happy with them that he showed the messengers his warehouse: the silver, gold, balsam, fine olive oil, his entire armory, and everything in his treasury. Hezekiah showed them everything in his palace and every corner of his kingdom.

18416.text: ¶Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah and asked, “What did these men say? And where did they come from?”¶Hezekiah answered, “They came to me from the distant country of Babylon.”

18417.text: ¶Isaiah asked, “What did they see in your palace?”¶Hezekiah answered, “They saw everything in my palace, and I showed them everything in my treasury.”

18418.text: ¶Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of Yahweh Tsebaoth!

18419.text: Yahweh says, ‘The days are going to come when everything in your palace, everything your ancestors have stored up to this day, will be taken away to Babylon. Nothing will be left.

18420.text: Some of your own descendants will be taken away. They will become officials in the palace of the king of Babylon.’”

18421.text: ¶Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “Yahweh’s word that you have spoken is good.” He added, “Just let there be peace and security as long as I live.”

18422.text: §¶“Comfort my people! Comfort them!” says your Elohim.

18423.text: ¶“Speak tenderly to Jerusalem and announce to it/_that its time of hard labor is over/_and its wrongs have been paid for./_It has received from Yahweh double for all its sins.”

18424.text: ¶A voice cries out in the desert:¶▼“Clear a way for Yahweh./_Make a straight highway in the wilderness for our Elohim.

18425.text: /Every valley will be raised./_Every mountain and hill will be lowered./_Steep places will be made level./_Rough places will be made smooth.

18426.text: /Then Yahweh’s glory will be revealed/_and all people will see it together./_Yahweh has spoken.”

18427.text: ¶A voice called, “Call out!”¶I asked, “What should I call out?”¶▼“Call out: All people are like grass,/_and all their beauty is like a flower in the field.

18428.text: /Grass dries up,/_and flowers wither when Yahweh’s breath blows on them./_Yes, people are like grass.

18429.text: /Grass dries up,/_and flowers wither,/_but the word of our Elohim will last forever.”

18430.text: ¶Go up a high mountain, Zion./_Tell the good news!/_Call out with a loud voice, Jerusalem./_Tell the good news!/_Raise your voice without fear./_Tell the cities of Judah:/_“Here is your Elohim!”

18431.text: ¶Adonay Yahweh is coming with power/_to rule with authority./_His reward is with him,/_and the people he has won arrive ahead of him.

18432.text: /Like a shepherd he takes care of his flock./_He gathers the lambs in his arms./_He carries them in his arms./_He gently helps the sheep and their lambs.

18433.text: §¶Who has measured the water of the sea with the palm of his hand/_or measured the sky with the length of his hand?/_Who has held the dust of the earth in a bushel basket/_or weighed the mountains on a scale and the hills on a balance?

18434.text: /Who has directed the Ruach Yahweh/_or instructed him as his adviser?

18435.text: /Whom did he consult?/_Who gave him understanding?/_Who taught him the right way?/_Who taught him knowledge?/_Who informed him about the way to understanding?

18436.text: ¶The nations are like a drop in a bucket/_and are considered to be like dust on a scale./_The weight of the islands is like fine dust.

18437.text: /All the trees in Lebanon are not enough to burn an offering./_Its wild animals are not enough for a single burnt offering.

18438.text: /All the nations amount to nothing in his presence./_He considers them less than nothing and worthless.

18439.text: /To whom, then, can you compare El?/_To what statue can you compare him?

18440.text: ¶Craftsmen make idols./_Goldsmiths cover them with gold./_Silversmiths make silver chains for them.

18441.text: /The poorest people choose wood that will not rot/_and search out skillful craftsmen/_to set up idols that will not fall over.

18442.text: /Don’t you know?/_Haven’t you heard?/_Haven’t you been told from the beginning?/_Don’t you understand the foundations of the earth?

18443.text: /God is enthroned above the earth,/_and those who live on it are like grasshoppers./_He stretches out the sky like a canopy/_and spreads it out like a tent to live in.

18444.text: /He makes rulers unimportant/_and makes earthly judges worth nothing.

18445.text: /They have hardly been planted./_They have hardly been sown./_They have hardly taken root in the ground./_Then he blows on them and they wither,/_and a windstorm sweeps them away like straw.

18446.text: /“To whom, then, can you compare me?/_Who is my equal?” asks the Holy One.

18447.text: ¶Look at the sky and see./_Who created these things?/_Who brings out the stars one by one?/_He calls them all by name./_Because of the greatness of his might and the strength of his power,/_not one of them is missing.

18448.text: /Jacob, why do you complain?/_Israel, why do you say,/_“My way is hidden from Yahweh,/_and my rights are ignored by my Elohim”?

18449.text: /Don’t you know?/_Haven’t you heard?/_El Olam, Yahweh, the Creator of the ends of the earth,/_doesn’t grow tired or become weary./_His understanding is beyond reach.

18450.text: /He gives strength to those who grow tired/_and increases the strength of those who are weak.

18451.text: /Even young people grow tired and become weary,/_and young men will stumble and fall.

18452.text: /Yet, the strength of those who wait with hope in Yahweh/_will be renewed./_They will soar on wings like eagles./_They will run and won’t become weary./_They will walk and won’t grow tired.

18453.text: §¶“Be silent and listen to me, you coastlands./_Let the people gain new strength./_Let them come near and speak./_Let us come together for judgment.

18454.text: ¶“Who has raised up from the east/_someone to whom Yahweh gives victory with every step he takes?/_Nations are handed over to him./_He defeats kings./_With his sword he turns them into dust./_With his bow he turns them into straw blown by the wind.

18455.text: /_He chases them, marching by safely/_on a path his feet have never traveled before.

18456.text: /Who has accomplished this?/_Who has determined the course of history from the beginning?/_I, Yahweh, was there first, and I will be there to the end./_I am the one!”

18457.text: ¶The coastlands have seen him and are afraid./_The ends of the earth tremble./_They have come near and gathered together.

18458.text: /People help their neighbors/_and say to their relatives, “Be brave!”

18459.text: /Craftsmen encourage goldsmiths./_Metalsmiths encourage blacksmiths who work at their anvils./_They say that their soldering is good./_And they fasten things with nails so they won’t move.

18460.text: ¶“But you are my servant Israel,/_Jacob, whom I have chosen,/_the descendant of Abraham, my dear friend.

18461.text: /I have taken you from the ends of the earth/_and called you from its most distant places./_I said to you, ‘You are my servant./_I’ve chosen you; I haven’t rejected you.’

18462.text: /Don’t be afraid, because I am with you./_Don’t be intimidated; I am your Elohim./_I will strengthen you./_I will help you./_I will support you with my victorious right hand.

18463.text: ¶“Everyone who is angry with you/_will be ashamed and disgraced./_Those who oppose you/_will be reduced to nothing and disappear.

18464.text: /You will search for your enemies,/_but you will not find them./_Those who are at war with you/_will be reduced to nothing and no longer exist.

18465.text: /I, Yahweh your Elohim, hold your right hand/_and say to you, ‘Don’t be afraid; I will help you.’

18466.text: /Don’t be afraid, Jacob, you worm./_You people of Israel, I will help you,”/_declares Yahweh, your Go’el, Qedosh Yisrael.

18467.text: /“I am going to make you into a new threshing sledge/_with sharp, double-edged teeth./_You will thresh the mountains and crush them to dust./_You will turn the hills into straw.

18468.text: /You will winnow them./_The wind will carry them away./_The windstorm will scatter them./_But you will find joy in Yahweh/_and praise Qedosh Yisrael.

18469.text: ¶“The poor and needy are looking for water, but there is none./_Their tongues are parched with thirst./_I, Yahweh, will answer them./_I, the Elohim of Israel, will not abandon them.

18470.text: /I will make rivers flow on bare hilltops./_I will make springs flow through valleys./_I will turn deserts into lakes./_I will turn dry land into springs.

18471.text: /I will plant cedar, acacia, myrtle, and wild olive trees in the desert./_I will place cedar, fir, and cypress trees together in the wilderness.

18472.text: /People will see and know./_Together they will consider and understand/_that Yahweh’s power has done this,/_that Qedosh Yisrael has created it.

18473.text: ¶“Present your case,” says Yahweh./_“Bring forward your best arguments,” says Jacob’s Melek.

18474.text: /“Bring your idols so they can tell us what’s going to happen./_Explain past events that your idols told you about/_so that we may consider them/_and know what their outcome will be./_Tell us about future events.

18475.text: /Tell us what’s going to happen/_so that we may know that you are gods./_Yes, do something, good or evil,/_to intimidate us and make us afraid.

18476.text: /You are nothing!/_You can’t do anything!/_Whoever chooses you is disgusting.

18477.text: ¶“I have raised up someone from the north, and he has come./_He will call on my name from the east./_He will attack rulers as if they were mud,/_as if he were treading on clay like a potter.

18478.text: /Who revealed this from the beginning so that we could know it?/_Who revealed this from the past so that we could say that he was right?/_No one revealed it./_No one announced it./_No one heard your words.

18479.text: /I was the first to tell Zion, ‘Look, here they are.’/_I gave Jerusalem a messenger with the good news.

18480.text: /When I look, there is no one./_There is no one to advise them./_When I ask them a question,/_will they give an answer?

18481.text: /All of them are nothing./_They can’t do anything./_Their statues are nothing but air.”

18482.text: §¶Here is my Ebed, whom I support./_Here is my chosen one, with whom I am pleased./_I have put my Ruach on him./_He will bring justice to the nations.

18483.text: /He will not cry out or raise his voice./_He will not make his voice heard in the streets.

18484.text: /He will not break off a damaged cattail./_He will not even put out a smoking wick./_He will faithfully bring about justice.

18485.text: /He will not be discouraged or crushed/_until he has set up justice on the earth./_The coastlands will wait for his teachings.

18486.text: ¶Yahweh El created the heavens and stretched them out./_He shaped the earth and all that comes from it./_He gave life to the people who are on it/_and breath to those who walk on it.¶►This is what Yahweh El says:

18487.text: ¶I, Yahweh, have called you to do what is right./_I will take hold of your hand./_I will protect you./_I will appoint you as my promise to the people,/_as my light to the nations.

18488.text: /_You will give sight to the blind,/_bring prisoners out of prisons,/_and bring those who live in darkness/_out of dungeons.

18489.text: /I am Yahweh; that is my name./_I will not give my glory to anyone else/_or the praise I deserve to idols.

18490.text: /What I said in the past has come true./_I will reveal new things before they happen.

18491.text: §¶Sing a new song to Yahweh./_Sing his praise from the ends of the earth,/_you people who sail on the seas/_and all the creatures that live in them,/_you coastlands and all who live on them.

18492.text: /Let those who live in the desert and its cities raise their voices./_Let those who live in the settlements of Kedar praise him./_Let those who live in Sela sing for joy./_Let them shout from the tops of the mountains.

18493.text: /Let them give glory to Yahweh/_and announce his praise on the coastlands.

18494.text: /Yahweh marches out like a warrior./_He prepares himself for battle like a soldier./_He shouts, gives the battle cry, and overpowers his enemies.

18495.text: ¶I have been silent for a long time./_I kept quiet and held myself back./_But like a woman in childbirth I will cry out./_I will gasp and pant.

18496.text: /I will lay waste to mountains and hills./_I will dry up all their vegetation./_I will turn rivers into islands./_I will dry up ponds.

18497.text: /I will lead the blind on unfamiliar roads./_I will lead them on unfamiliar paths./_I will turn darkness into light in front of them./_I will make rough places smooth./_These are the things I will do for them,/_and I will never abandon them.

18498.text: /Then those who trust idols/_and those who say to statues,/_“You are our gods”/_will be turned away and put to shame.

18499.text: §¶Listen, you deaf people./_Look, you blind people, so that you can see.

18500.text: /Who is blind except my servant/_or deaf like the messenger I send?/_Who is blind like the one who has my trust/_or blind like the servant of Yahweh?

18501.text: /You have seen much, but you do not observe anything./_Your ears are open, but you hear nothing.

18502.text: /Yahweh is pleased because he does what is right./_He praises the greatness of his teachings and makes them glorious.

18503.text: /But these people are robbed and looted./_They are all trapped in pits and hidden in prisons./_They have become prey with no one to rescue them./_They have become loot with no one to say, “Give it back.”

18504.text: /Who among you will listen to this?/_Is there anyone who will pay attention and listen in the future?

18505.text: /Who gave Jacob away as loot/_and handed Israel over to robbers?/_Wasn’t it Yahweh, against whom we have sinned?/_They didn’t want to live his way./_They didn’t obey his teachings.

18506.text: /So he poured out his burning anger and the horrors of war on them./_It engulfed them in flames, but they did not understand./_It burned them, but they did not take it to heart.

18507.text: ¶Yahweh created Jacob and formed Israel. Now, this is what Yahweh says:¶▼Do not be afraid, because I have reclaimed you./_I have called you by name; you are mine.

18508.text: /When you go through the sea, I am with you./_When you go through rivers, they will not sweep you away./_When you walk through fire, you will not be burned,/_and the flames will not harm you.

18509.text: /I am Yahweh your Elohim, Qedosh Yisrael, your Savior./_Egypt is the ransom I exchanged for you./_Sudan and Seba are the price I paid for you.

18510.text: /Since you are precious to me, you are honored and I love you./_I will exchange others for you./_Nations will be the price I pay for your life.

18511.text: ¶Do not be afraid, because I am with you./_I will bring your descendants from the east/_and gather you from the west.

18512.text: /I will say to the north, “Give them up,”/_and to the south, “Do not keep them.”/_Bring my sons from far away/_and my daughters from the ends of the earth.

18513.text: /Bring everyone who is called by my name,/_whom I created for my glory,/_whom I formed and made.

18514.text: /Bring the people who are blind but still have eyes,/_the people who are deaf but still have ears.

18515.text: /All nations have gathered together, and people have assembled./_Who among them could have revealed this?/_Who among them could have foretold this to us?/_They should bring their witnesses to prove that they were right./_Let the people hear them. Then they will say that it is true.

18516.text: ¶“You are my witnesses,” declares Yahweh./_“I have chosen you as my servant/_so that you can know and believe in me/_and understand that I am the one who did this./_No god was formed before me,/_and there will be none after me.

18517.text: /I alone am Yahweh,/_and there is no savior except me.

18518.text: /I have revealed it to you, I have saved you,/_and I have announced it to you./_There was no foreign god among you./_You are my witnesses that I am El,” declares Yahweh.

18519.text: /“From the first day I was the one who did this./_No one can rescue people from my power./_When I do something, who can undo it?”

18520.text: /This is what Yahweh, your Go’el, Qedosh Yisrael, says:¶For your sake I will send an army to Babylon./_I will bring back all the Babylonian refugees/_in the ships that they take pride in.

18521.text: /I am Yahweh, your Holy One,/_the Creator of Israel, your Melek.

18522.text: §¶Yahweh makes a path through the sea/_and a road through the strong currents.

18523.text: /He leads chariots and horses, an army and reinforcements./_(They lie down together and do not get up again./_They are extinguished and snuffed out like a wick.)¶►This is what Yahweh says:

18524.text: ¶Forget what happened in the past,/_and do not dwell on events from long ago.

18525.text: /I am going to do something new./_It is already happening. Don’t you recognize it?/_I will clear a way in the desert./_I will make rivers on dry land.

18526.text: /Wild animals, jackals, and ostriches will honor me./_I will provide water in the desert./_I will make rivers on the dry land for my chosen people to drink.

18527.text: /I have formed these people for myself./_They will praise me.

18528.text: ¶Jacob, you have not prayed to me./_Israel, you have grown tired of me.

18529.text: /You did not bring me sheep for your burnt offerings/_or honor me with your sacrifices./_I did not burden you by requiring grain offerings/_or trouble you by requiring incense offerings.

18530.text: /You did not buy me any sugar cane with your money/_or satisfy me with the best part of your sacrifices./_Rather, you burdened me with your sins/_and troubled me with your wrongdoings.

18531.text: ¶I alone am the one who is going to wipe away your rebellious actions/_for my own sake./_I will not remember your sins anymore.

18532.text: /Remind me of what happened./_Let us argue our case together./_State your case so that you can prove you are right.

18533.text: /Your first ancestor sinned,/_and your priests rebelled against me.

18534.text: /That is why I will corrupt the leaders of the holy place./_I will claim Jacob for destruction./_I will set up Israel for ridicule.

18535.text: ¶But now listen, my servant Jacob,/_Israel, whom I have chosen.

18536.text: /Yahweh made you, formed you in the womb, and will help you.¶►This is what Yahweh says:¶▼Don’t be afraid, my servant Jacob,/_Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.

18537.text: /I will pour water on thirsty ground and rain on dry land./_I will pour my Ruach on your offspring/_and my blessing on your descendants.

18538.text: /They will spring up with the grass/_as poplars spring up by streams.

18539.text: /One person will say, “I belong to Yahweh.”/_Another will call on the name of Jacob./_Another will write on his hand, “Yahweh’s,”/_and he will adopt the name of Israel.

18540.text: §¶Yahweh is Israel’s Melek and Go’el./_He is Yahweh Tsebaoth.¶►This is what Yahweh says:¶▼I am the first and the last,/_and there is no Elohim except me.

18541.text: /If there is anyone like me, let him say so./_Let him tell me what happened/_when I established my people long ago./_Then let him predict what will happen to them.

18542.text: /Don’t be terrified or afraid./_Didn’t I make this known to you long ago?/_You are my witnesses./_Is there any Elohim except me?/_There is no other rock; I know of none.

18543.text: ¶All who make idols are nothing. Their precious treasures are worthless. Their own witnesses do not see or know anything, so they will be put to shame.

18544.text: Nothing comes from making gods or casting metal idols.

18545.text: Everyone associated with the gods will be put to shame. The craftsmen themselves are only human. Let them all get together and take their stand. They will be frightened and ashamed together.

18546.text: ¶Blacksmiths shape iron into tools. They work them over the coals and shape them with hammers, working them with their strong arms. They get hungry, and their strength fails. If they don’t drink water, they will faint.

18547.text: ¶Carpenters measure blocks of wood with chalk lines. They mark them with pens. They carve them with chisels and mark them with compasses. They carve them into forms of people, beautiful people, so the idols can live in shrines.

18548.text: ¶They cut down cedars for themselves. Then they choose fir trees or oaks. They let them grow strong among the trees in the forest. Then they plant cedars, and the rain makes them grow.

18549.text: These trees become fuel for people to burn. So they take some of them and warm themselves with them. They start fires and bake bread. They also make gods from these trees and worship them. They make them into carved statues and bow in front of them.

18550.text: Half of the wood they burn in the fire. Over this half they roast meat that they can eat until they are full. They also warm themselves and say, “Ah! We are warm. We can see the fire!”

18551.text: But the rest of the wood they make into gods, carved statues. They bow to them and worship them. They pray to them, saying, “Rescue us, because you are our gods.”

18552.text: ¶They don’t know or understand anything. Their eyes are plastered shut, so they can’t see. And their minds are closed, so they can’t understand.

18553.text: No one stops to think. No one has enough knowledge or understanding to say, “I burned half of the wood in the fire. I also baked bread over its coals. I roasted meat and ate it. Now I am making the rest of the wood into a disgusting thing and bowing to a block of wood.”

18554.text: They eat ashes because they are deceived. Their own misguided minds lead them astray. They can’t rescue themselves or ask themselves, “Isn’t what I hold in my right hand a false god?”

18555.text: ¶Remember these things, Jacob:/_You are my servant, Israel./_I formed you; you are my servant./_Israel, I will not forget you.

18556.text: /I made your rebellious acts disappear like a thick cloud/_and your sins like the morning mist./_Come back to me, because I have reclaimed you.

18557.text: ¶Sing with joy, you heavens, because Yahweh has done this./_Rejoice, you deep places of the earth./_Break into shouts of joy, you mountains,/_you forests and every tree in them./_Yahweh has reclaimed Jacob./_He will display his glory in Israel.

18558.text: §¶Yahweh reclaimed you./_He formed you in the womb.¶►This is what Yahweh says:¶▼I, Yahweh, made everything./_I stretched out the heavens by myself./_I spread out the earth all alone.

18559.text: /I cause the signs of false prophets to fail/_and make fools of fortunetellers./_I make wise men retreat/_and turn their knowledge into foolishness.

18560.text: ¶He confirms the word of his servant/_and fulfills the plan of his messengers./_He says about Jerusalem, “It will be inhabited.”/_He says about the cities of Judah, “They will be rebuilt.”/_He says about their ruins, “I will restore them.”

18561.text: /He says to the deep water, “Dry up.”/_So I will dry up your rivers.

18562.text: /He says about Cyrus, “He is my shepherd./_He will do everything I want him to do.”/_He says about Jerusalem, “It will be rebuilt.”/_He says about the temple, “Your foundation will be laid.”

18563.text: ¶This is what Yahweh says about Cyrus, his anointed one:¶▼I have held him by his right hand/_so he could conquer the nations ahead of him,/_strip kings of their power,/_and open doors ahead of him/_so that the gates would not be shut.

18564.text: /I will go ahead of you, Cyrus, and smooth out the rough places./_I will break down the bronze doors and cut through the iron bars.

18565.text: /I will give you treasures from dark places and hidden stockpiles./_Then you will know that I, Yahweh Elohim of Israel,/_have called you by name.

18566.text: ¶For the sake of my servant Jacob,/_Israel, my chosen one,/_I have called you by name./_I have given you a title of honor, although you don’t know me.

18567.text: /I am Yahweh, and there is no other./_There is no other Elohim besides me./_I will strengthen you, although you don’t know me,

18568.text: /_so that from the east to the west people will know/_that there is no Elohim except me./_I am Yahweh, and there is no other.

18569.text: /I make light and create darkness./_I make blessings and create disasters./_I, Yahweh, do all these things.

18570.text: ¶Rain down from above, you heavens,/_and pour down righteousness, you skies./_Let the earth open./_Let salvation and righteousness sprout./_Let them spring up./_I, Yahweh, have created them.

18571.text: ¶How horrible it will be for the one who quarrels with his maker./_He is pottery among other earthenware pots./_Does the clay ask the one who shapes it, “What are you making?”/_Does your work say to you, “There are no handles”?

18572.text: /How horrible it will be for the one/_who says to his father, “Why did you conceive me?”/_or to his mother, “Why did you go through labor pains for me?”

18573.text: ¶Yahweh is the Holy One and the maker of Israel.¶►This is what Yahweh says:¶▼Ask me about what is going to happen to my children!/_Are you going to give me orders concerning my handiwork?

18574.text: /I made the earth and created humans on it./_I stretched out the heavens with my own hands./_I commanded all the stars to shine.

18575.text: /I prepared Cyrus for my righteous purpose./_I will make all his roads straight./_He will build my city and let my exiles go free/_without any payment or any reward, says Yahweh Tsebaoth.

18576.text: ¶This is what Yahweh says:¶▼The products from Egypt, the merchandise from Sudan,/_and the important Sabaeans will come to you./_They will belong to you./_They will follow you./_They will come to you in chains./_They will bow to you and pray to you,/_“Certainly El is with you alone, and there is no other Elohim.”

18577.text: ¶Certainly, you are an El who has hidden himself./_You are the Elohim of Israel, the Savior!

18578.text: /Those who make idols will be ashamed and disgraced./_They will go away completely disgraced.

18579.text: /Israel has been saved by Yahweh forever./_You will never again be ashamed or disgraced.

18580.text: ¶Yahweh created the heavens./_Elohim formed the earth and made it./_He set it up./_He did not create it to be empty/_but formed it to be inhabited.¶►This is what Yahweh says:¶▼I am Yahweh, and there is no other.

18581.text: /I haven’t spoken privately or in some dark corner of the world./_I didn’t say to Jacob’s descendants,/_“Search for me in vain!”/_I, Yahweh, speak what is fair and say what is right.

18582.text: ¶Come here, you refugees from the nations./_Ignorant people carry wooden idols/_and pray to gods that cannot save anyone.

18583.text: /Speak and present your case. Yes, let them consult one another./_Who revealed this in the distant past and predicted it long ago?/_Wasn’t it I, Yahweh?/_There is no other Elohim except me./_There is no other righteous God and Savior besides me.

18584.text: ¶Turn to me and be saved, all who live at the ends of the earth,/_because I am El, and there is no other.

18585.text: /I have bound myself with an oath./_A word has gone out from my righteous mouth/_that will not be recalled,/_“Every knee will bow to me/_and every tongue will swear allegiance.”

18586.text: /It will be said of me,/_“Certainly, righteousness and strength are found in Yahweh alone.”¶All who are angry with him will come to him and be ashamed.

18587.text: /All the descendants of Israel will be declared righteous,/_and they will praise Yahweh.

18588.text: §¶The god Bel bows down; the god Nebo stoops low./_Their statues are seated on animals and cattle./_The gods that you carry are burdens, a load for weary people.

18589.text: /These gods stoop low and bow down together./_They aren’t able to escape with heavy loads./_They go away into captivity.

18590.text: ¶Listen to me, descendants of Jacob,/_the few people left of the nation of Israel./_I’ve carried you since your birth./_I’ve taken care of you from the time you were born.

18591.text: /_Even when you’re old, I’ll take care of you./_Even when your hair turns gray, I’ll support you./_I made you and will continue to care for you./_I’ll support you and save you.

18592.text: ¶To whom will you compare me and make me equal?/_To whom will you compare me so that we can be alike?

18593.text: ¶People pour gold out of their bags and weigh silver on scales./_They hire a goldsmith. He makes it into a god./_They bow down and worship it.

18594.text: /They lift it on their shoulders and carry it./_They set the idol in its place, and it stands there./_It doesn’t move from its place./_If they cry to it for help, it can’t answer./_It can’t rescue them from their distress.

18595.text: ¶Remember this, and take courage./_Recall your rebellious acts.

18596.text: /Remember the first events,/_because I am El, and there is no other./_I am Elohim, and there’s no one like me.

18597.text: /From the beginning I revealed the end./_From long ago I told you things that had not yet happened, saying,/_“My plan will stand, and I’ll do everything I intended to do.”

18598.text: /I will call a bird of prey from the east./_I will call someone for my plan from a faraway land./_I have spoken, and I will bring it about./_I have planned it, and I will do it.

18599.text: /Listen to me, you stubborn people who are far from being righteous.

18600.text: /I’ll bring my righteousness near; it isn’t far away./_My salvation will not be delayed./_I’ll provide salvation for Zion/_and bring my glory to Israel.

18601.text: §¶Go, sit in the dirt,/_virgin princess of Babylon!/_Sit on the ground, not on a throne,/_princess of the Babylonians!/_You will no longer be called soft and delicate.

18602.text: /Take millstones and grind flour./_Remove your veil./_Take off your skirt./_Uncover your legs, and cross the river.

18603.text: /People will see you naked./_People will see your shame./_I will take revenge./_I won’t spare anyone.

18604.text: ¶Our Go’el is Qedosh Yisrael./_His name is Yahweh Tsebaoth.

18605.text: ¶Go into the dark, and sit in silence,/_princess of the Babylonians!/_You will no longer be called the queen of kingdoms.

18606.text: /I was angry with my people./_I dishonored those who belong to me./_I put them under your control./_You showed them no mercy./_You placed a heavy burden on old people.

18607.text: /You said, “I will always be a queen.”/_You didn’t carefully consider these things/_or keep in mind how they would end.

18608.text: ¶Now then, listen to this, you lover of pleasure./_You live securely and say to yourself,/_“I’m the only one, and there’s no one else./_I won’t live as a widow./_I won’t suffer the loss of children.”

18609.text: /In one day both of these will happen to you instantly:/_the loss of your children and your husband./_All this will happen to you in spite of/_your evil magic and your many spells.

18610.text: /You feel safe in your wickedness/_and say, “No one can see me.”/_Your wisdom and knowledge have led you astray,/_so you say to yourself,/_“I’m the only one, and there’s no one else.”

18611.text: /But evil will happen to you./_You won’t know how to keep it away./_Disaster will strike you./_You won’t be able to stop it./_Destruction will overtake you suddenly./_You won’t expect it.

18612.text: ¶Keep practicing your spells and your evil magic./_You have practiced them ever since you were young./_You may succeed./_You may cause terror.

18613.text: /You are worn out by your many plans./_Let your astrologers and your stargazers,/_who foretell the future month by month,/_come to you, rise up, and save you.

18614.text: /They are like straw./_Fire burns them./_They can’t rescue themselves from the flames./_There are no glowing coals to keep them warm/_and no fire for them to sit by.

18615.text: /This is how it will be for those who have worked with you,/_for those who have been with you ever since you were young./_They will go their own ways,/_and there will be no one to save you.

18616.text: §¶Listen to this, descendants of Jacob!/_You are given the name of Israel./_You are descended from Judah./_You take oaths by the name of Yahweh./_You acknowledge the Elohim of Israel,/_but you are not honest or sincere.

18617.text: /You call yourselves citizens of the holy city./_You depend on the Elohim of Israel./_His name is Yahweh Tsebaoth.

18618.text: ¶From the beginning I revealed to you what would happen./_These words came out of my mouth,/_and I made them known./_Suddenly, I acted, and they happened.

18619.text: /I know that you are stubborn./_Like iron, you are hardheaded./_Like bronze, nothing gets through your thick skull.

18620.text: /That is why I revealed to you what would happen long ago./_I told you about them before they happened./_I did this so you couldn’t say,/_“My gods have done these things./_My carved idols and my metal idols/_have commanded them to happen.”

18621.text: /You’ve heard these words./_Now look at all this./_Won’t you admit it?¶From now on I will reveal to you new things,/_hidden things that you do not know.

18622.text: /They are created now, not in the past./_You haven’t heard about them before today,/_so you can’t say that you already knew about them.

18623.text: /You have never heard about them./_You have never known about them./_Your ears have never been open to hear them before./_I know that you’ve acted very treacherously/_and that you have been called a rebel since you were born.

18624.text: /For my name’s sake I’ll be patient./_For my glory’s sake I’ll hold my anger back from you,/_rather than destroy you.

18625.text: /I have refined you,/_but not like silver./_I have tested you in the furnace of suffering.

18626.text: /I am doing this for myself, only for myself./_Why should my name be dishonored?/_I will not give my glory to anyone else.

18627.text: ¶Listen to me, Jacob,/_Israel, whom I have called./_I am the one./_I am the first and the last.

18628.text: /My hand laid the foundation of the earth./_My right hand stretched out the heavens./_When I call for them, they both stand.

18629.text: /Gather together, all of you, and listen./_What idol has revealed such things?/_Yahweh loves Cyrus./_He will carry out Yahweh’s plan against Babylon./_He will use his strength against the Babylonians.

18630.text: /I alone have spoken./_I have called him./_I will bring him here, and he will succeed.

18631.text: ¶Come here. Listen to this:/_From the beginning I have spoken nothing in private./_From the time it took place, I was there.¶Now Adonay Yahweh has sent me and his Ruach.

18632.text: ¶This is what Yahweh, your Go’el, Qedosh Yisrael, says:¶▼I am Yahweh your Elohim./_I teach you what is best for you./_I lead you where you should go.

18633.text: /If only you had listened to my commands!/_Your peace would be like a river that never runs dry./_Your righteousness would be like waves on the sea.

18634.text: /Your descendants would be like sand./_Your children would be like its grains./_Their names would not be cut off or wiped out in my presence.

18635.text: /Leave Babylon; flee from the Babylonians!/_Shout for joy as you tell it and announce it./_Shout it out to the ends of the earth./_Say that Yahweh has reclaimed his servant Jacob.

18636.text: /They weren’t thirsty when he led them through the deserts./_He made water flow from a rock for them./_He split a rock, and water gushed out.

18637.text: ¶“There is no peace for the wicked,” says Yahweh.

18638.text: §¶Listen to me, you islands./_Pay attention, you people far away./_Before I was born, Yahweh chose me./_While I was in my mother’s womb, he recorded my name.

18639.text: /He made my tongue like a sharp sword/_and hid me in the palm of his hand./_He made me like a sharpened arrow/_and hid me in his quiver.

18640.text: ¶He said to me,/_“You are my servant Israel./_I will display my glory through you.”

18641.text: /But I said,/_“I have worked hard for nothing./_I have used my strength, but I didn’t accomplish anything./_Yet, certainly my case is in Yahweh’s hands,/_and my reward is with my Elohim.”

18642.text: ¶Yahweh formed me in the womb to be his servant/_in order to bring Jacob back to him/_and gather Israel to him./_(Yahweh honors me,/_and my Elohim has become my strength.)

18643.text: ¶Now, Yahweh says,¶▼“You are not just my servant/_who restores the tribes of Jacob/_and brings back those in Israel whom I have preserved./_I have also made you a light for the nations/_so that you would save people all over the world.”

18644.text: ¶Yahweh is the Go’el of Israel, its Holy One.¶►This is what Yahweh says to the despised one, to the one scorned by the nation, to the slave of rulers:¶▼Kings will see you and stand./_Princes will see you and bow./_Yahweh is faithful./_Qedosh Yisrael has chosen you.

18645.text: ¶This is what Yahweh says:¶▼In the time of favor I will answer you./_In the day of salvation I will help you./_I will protect you./_I will appoint you as my promise to the people./_You will restore the land./_You will make them inherit the desolate inheritance.

18646.text: /You will say to the prisoners, “Come out,”/_and to those who are in darkness, “Show yourselves.”¶They will graze along every path,/_and they will find pastures on every bare hill.

18647.text: /They will never be hungry or thirsty,/_nor will the sun or the burning, hot wind strike them./_The one who has compassion on them will lead them/_and guide them to springs.

18648.text: /I will turn all my mountains into roads,/_and my highways will be restored.

18649.text: /They will come from far away./_They will come from the north and from the west,/_and they will come from the land of Sinim.

18650.text: ¶Sing with joy, you heavens!/_Rejoice, you earth!/_Break into shouts of joy, you mountains!/_Yahweh has comforted his people/_and will have compassion on his humble people.

18651.text: §¶But Zion said, “Yahweh has abandoned me./_My Adonay has forgotten me.”

18652.text: ¶Can a woman forget her nursing child?/_Will she have no compassion on the child from her womb?/_Although mothers may forget,/_I will not forget you.

18653.text: /I have engraved you on the palms of my hands./_Your walls are always in my presence.

18654.text: /Your children will hurry back./_Those who destroyed you and laid waste to you will leave you.

18655.text: /Look up, look around, and watch!/_All of your children are gathering together and returning to you./_“I solemnly swear as I live,” declares Yahweh,/_“you will wear all of them like jewels/_and display them on yourself as a bride would.”

18656.text: ¶Though you are destroyed and demolished and your land is in ruins,/_you will be too crowded for your people now./_Those who devoured you will be long gone.

18657.text: /The children taken from you will say to you,/_“This place is too crowded for me./_Make room for me to live here.”

18658.text: /Then you will ask yourself,/_“Who has fathered these children for me?/_I was childless and unable to have children./_I was exiled and rejected./_Who raised these children for me?/_I was left alone./_Where have they come from?”

18659.text: ¶This is what Adonay Yahweh says:¶▼I will lift my hand to signal the nations./_I will raise my flag for the people./_They will bring your sons in their arms/_and carry your daughters on their shoulders.

18660.text: /Then kings will be your foster fathers,/_and their queens will nurse you./_They will bow in front of you/_with their faces touching the ground./_They will lick the dust at your feet./_Then you will know that I am Yahweh./_Those who wait with hope for me will not be put to shame.

18661.text: ¶Can loot be taken away from mighty men/_or prisoners be freed from conquerors?

18662.text: ¶This is what Yahweh says:¶▼Prisoners will be freed from mighty men./_Loot will be taken away from tyrants./_I will fight your enemies,/_and I will save your children.

18663.text: /I will make your oppressors eat their own flesh,/_and they will become drunk on their own blood/_as though it were new wine./_Then all humanity will know that I am Yahweh, who saves you,/_the Mighty One of Jacob, who reclaims you.

18664.text: §¶This is what Yahweh says:¶▼Where are your mother’s divorce papers?/_Did I give her any to get rid of her?/_To which of my creditors did I sell you?/_You were sold because of your sins./_I got rid of your mother because of your rebellion.

18665.text: /Why was no one here when I came?/_Why was no one here to answer when I called?/_Am I too weak to reclaim you?/_Don’t I have the power to rescue you?/_I dry up the sea with my command,/_and I turn rivers into deserts./_Their fish stink because there is no water,/_and people die of thirst.

18666.text: /I clothe the heavens in darkness/_and cover them with sackcloth.

18667.text: §¶Adonay Yahweh will teach me what to say,/_so I will know how to encourage weary people./_Morning after morning he will wake me/_to listen like a student.

18668.text: /Adonay Yahweh will open my ears./_I will not rebel, nor will I turn away from him.

18669.text: /I will offer my back to those who whip me/_and my cheeks to those who pluck hairs out of my beard./_I will not turn my face away from those who humiliate me/_and spit on me.

18670.text: ¶Adonay Yahweh helps me./_That is why I will not be ashamed./_I have set my face like a flint./_I know that I will not be put to shame.

18671.text: /The one who pronounces me innocent is near./_Who will bring a case against me?/_Let us confront each other!/_Who accuses me?/_Let him confront me!

18672.text: /Adonay Yahweh helps me./_Who will find me guilty?/_They will all wear out like a garment./_Moths will eat them.

18673.text: ¶Who among you fears Yahweh/_and obeys his Ebed?/_Let those who walk in darkness and have no light/_trust the name of Yahweh/_and depend upon their Elohim.

18674.text: ¶But all of you light fires/_and arm yourselves with flaming torches./_So walk in your own light/_and among the torches you have lit.¶This is what you will receive from me:/_You will be tormented.

18675.text: §¶Listen to me, you people who pursue what is right and seek Yahweh./_Look to the rock from which you were cut/_and to the quarry from which you were dug.

18676.text: /Look to Abraham, your ancestor,/_and to Sarah, from whom you are descended./_When I called Abraham, he was childless./_I blessed him and gave him many descendants.

18677.text: /So Yahweh will comfort Zion./_He will comfort all those who live among its ruins./_He will make its desert like Eden./_He will make its wilderness like the garden of Yahweh./_Joy and gladness will be found in it,/_thanksgiving and the sound of singing.

18678.text: ¶Pay attention to me, my people./_Open your ears to hear me, my nation./_My teachings will go out from me./_My justice will become a light for the people.

18679.text: /My righteousness is near./_My salvation is on the way./_I will bring justice to people./_The coastlands put their hope in me,/_and they wait eagerly for me.

18680.text: /Look at the sky./_Look at the earth below./_The sky will vanish like smoke./_The earth will wear out like clothing,/_and those who live there will die like flies./_But my salvation will last forever,/_and my righteousness will never fail.

18681.text: ¶Listen to me, you people who know righteousness,/_you people who have my teachings in your hearts./_Don’t be afraid of being insulted by people./_Don’t be discouraged by their ridicule.

18682.text: /Moths will eat them like clothing./_Worms will devour them like wool./_But my righteousness will last forever,/_and my salvation will last throughout every generation.

18683.text: ¶Wake up! Wake up! Clothe yourself with strength, O Yahweh!/_Wake up as you did in days long past, as in generations long ago./_Didn’t you cut Rahab into pieces and stab the serpent?

18684.text: /Didn’t you dry up the sea, the water of the great ocean?/_You made a road in the depths of the sea/_so that the people reclaimed by the Lord/_might pass through it.

18685.text: /The people ransomed by Yahweh will return./_They will come to Zion singing with joy./_Everlasting happiness will be on their heads as a crown./_They will be glad and joyful./_They will have no sorrow or grief.

18686.text: ¶I alone am the one who comforts you./_Why, then, are you afraid of mortals, who must die,/_of humans, who are like grass?

18687.text: /Why have you forgotten Yahweh, your Creator?/_He stretched out the heavens/_and laid the foundations of the earth./_Why should you live in constant fear of the fury/_of those who oppress you,/_of those who are ready to destroy you?/_Where is the fury of those who oppress you?
