18688.text: /Chained prisoners will be set free./_They will not die in prison./_They will not go without food.

18689.text: /I am Yahweh your Elohim who stirs up the sea/_and makes its waves roar./_My name is Yahweh Tsebaoth.

18690.text: /I put my words in your mouth/_and sheltered you in the palm of my hand./_I stretched out the heavens,/_laid the foundations of the earth,/_and said to Zion, “You are my people.”

18691.text: §¶Wake up! Wake up!/_Stand up, Jerusalem!/_You drank from the cup in Yahweh’s hand./_That cup was filled with his anger./_You drank from the bowl, the cup that makes people stagger,/_and you drained it!

18692.text: /From all the children she gave birth to,/_there was no one to guide her./_From all the children she raised,/_there was no one to take her by the hand.

18693.text: /Twice as many disasters have happened to you./_Who will feel sorry for you?/_Violence, destruction, famine, and war have happened to you./_Who will comfort you?

18694.text: /Your children have fainted./_They lie sleeping at every street corner./_They are like an antelope caught in a net./_They experience the anger of Yahweh,/_the fury of your Elohim.

18695.text: ¶Listen to this, you humble people/_who are drunk but not from wine.

18696.text: /Yahweh your Elohim defends his people.¶►This is what your Adonay says:¶▼I’m taking from your hand the cup that makes people stagger,/_the bowl, the cup of my fury./_You will never drink from it again.

18697.text: /I will put it in the hands of those who made you suffer./_They said to you, “Lie down so that we can walk over you.”/_So you made your back like the ground/_and like a street for them to cross.

18698.text: §¶Wake up! Wake up! Clothe yourself with strength, Zion!/_Put on your beautiful clothes, holy city of Jerusalem./_Godless and evil people will no longer come to you.

18699.text: /Shake the dust from yourselves./_Get up, captive Jerusalem./_Free yourself from the chains around your neck, captive people of Zion.

18700.text: ¶This is what Yahweh says: You were sold, but no price was paid. You will be bought back, but without money.

18701.text: ¶This is what Adonay Yahweh says: In the beginning my people went to Egypt to live there as foreigners. Later the Assyrians oppressed them for no reason.

18702.text: So what do I find here? asks Yahweh. My people are taken away for no reason. Their rulers are screaming, declares Yahweh. And my name is cursed all day long.

18703.text: Now my people will know my name. When that day comes, they will know that I am the one who says, “Here I am!”

18704.text: ¶How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of the messenger/_who announces the good news, “All is well.”/_He brings the good news,/_announces salvation,/_and tells Zion that its Elohim rules as king.

18705.text: /Listen! Your watchmen raise their voices/_and shout together joyfully./_When Yahweh brings Zion back,/_they will see it with their own eyes.

18706.text: /Break out into shouts of joy, ruins of Jerusalem./_Yahweh will comfort his people./_He will reclaim Jerusalem.

18707.text: /Yahweh will show his holy power to all the nations./_All the ends of the earth will see the salvation of our Elohim.

18708.text: ¶Run away! Run away!/_Get away from there!/_Do not touch anything unclean./_Get away from it!/_Make yourselves pure,/_you Levites who carry the utensils for Yahweh’s temple.

18709.text: ¶You will not go away in a hurry,/_nor will you go away quickly./_Yahweh will go ahead of you./_The Elohim of Israel will guard you from behind.

18710.text: §¶My servant will be successful./_He will be respected, praised, and highly honored.

18711.text: /Many will be shocked by him./_His appearance will be so disfigured/_that he won’t look like any other man./_His looks will be so disfigured/_that he will hardly look like a human.

18712.text: /He will cleanse many nations with his blood./_Kings will shut their mouths because of him./_They will see things that they had never been told./_They will understand things that they had never heard.

18713.text: ¶Who has believed our message?¶To whom has Yahweh’s power been revealed?

18714.text: ¶He grew up in his presence like a young tree,/_like a root out of dry ground./_He had no form or majesty that would make us look at him./_He had nothing in his appearance that would make us desire him.

18715.text: /He was despised and rejected by people./_He was an Ish Makoboth, familiar with suffering./_He was despised like one from whom people turn their faces,/_and we didn’t consider him to be worth anything.

18716.text: /He certainly has taken upon himself our suffering/_and carried our sorrows,/_but we thought that Elohim had wounded him,/_beat him, and punished him.

18717.text: /He was wounded for our rebellious acts./_He was crushed for our sins./_He was punished so that we could have peace,/_and we received healing from his wounds.

18718.text: ¶We have all strayed like sheep./_Each one of us has turned to go his own way,/_and Yahweh has laid all our sins on him.

18719.text: /He was abused and punished,/_but he didn’t open his mouth./_He was led like a lamb to the slaughter./_He was like a sheep that is silent/_when its wool is cut off./_He didn’t open his mouth.

18720.text: ¶He was arrested, taken away, and judged./_Who would have thought that he would be removed/_from the world?/_He was killed because of my people’s rebellion.

18721.text: /He was placed in a tomb with the wicked./_He was put there with the rich when he died,/_although he had done nothing violent/_and had never spoken a lie.

18722.text: ¶Yet, it was Yahweh’s will to crush him with suffering./_When Yahweh has made his life a sacrifice for our wrongdoings,/_he will see his descendants for many days./_The will of Yahweh will succeed through him.

18723.text: /He will see and be satisfied/_because of his suffering./_My righteous Ebed will acquit many people/_because of what he has learned through suffering./_He will carry their sins as a burden.

18724.text: ¶So I will give him a share among the mighty,/_and he will divide the prize with the strong,/_because he poured out his life in death/_and he was counted with sinners./_He carried the sins of many./_He intercedes for those who are rebellious.

18725.text: §¶Sing with joy, you childless women who never gave birth to children./_Break into shouts of joy, you women who never had birth pains./_“There will be more children of women who have been deserted/_than there are children of married women,” says Yahweh.

18726.text: /Expand the space of your tent./_Stretch out the curtains of your tent, and don’t hold back./_Lengthen your tent ropes, and drive in the tent pegs.

18727.text: /You will spread out to the right and left./_Your descendants will take over other nations,/_and they will resettle deserted cities.

18728.text: /Don’t be afraid, because you won’t be put to shame./_Don’t be discouraged, because you won’t be disgraced./_You’ll forget the shame you’ve had since you were young./_You won’t remember the disgrace of your husband’s death anymore.

18729.text: /_Your husband is your maker./_His name is Yahweh Tsebaoth./_Your Go’el is Qedosh Yisrael./_He is called the Elohim of the whole earth.

18730.text: ¶“Yahweh has called you as if you were/_a wife who was abandoned and in grief,/_a wife who married young and was rejected,” says your Elohim.

18731.text: ¶“I abandoned you for one brief moment,/_but I will bring you back with unlimited compassion.

18732.text: /I hid my face from you for a moment in a burst of anger,/_but I will have compassion on you with everlasting kindness,”/_says Yahweh your Go’el.

18733.text: /“To me this is like Noah’s floodwaters, when I swore an oath/_that Noah’s floodwaters would never cover the earth again./_So now I swear an oath not to be angry with you or punish you.

18734.text: /The mountains may move, and the hills may shake,/_but my kindness will never depart from you./_My promise of peace will never change,”/_says Yahweh, who has compassion on you.

18735.text: ¶“You suffering, comfortless, storm-ravaged city!/_I will rebuild your city with precious stones./_I will reset your foundations with sapphires.

18736.text: /I will rebuild your towers with rubies,/_your gates with sparkling stones,/_and all your walls with precious stones.”

18737.text: ¶All your children will be taught by Yahweh,/_and your children will have unlimited peace.

18738.text: /You will be established in righteousness./_You will be far from oppression,/_so you will not be afraid./_You will be far from destruction,/_so it won’t come near you.

18739.text: ¶“If anyone attacks you, it will not be my doing./_Whoever attacks you will be defeated by you.

18740.text: /I’ve created blacksmiths to fan the coals into flames/_and to produce useful weapons./_I’ve also created destroyers to bring destruction.

18741.text: /No weapon that has been made to be used against you will succeed./_You will have an answer for anyone who accuses you./_This is the inheritance of Yahweh’s servants./_Their victory comes from me,” declares Yahweh.

18742.text: §¶“Listen! Whoever is thirsty, come to the water!/_Whoever has no money can come, buy, and eat!/_Come, buy wine and milk. You don’t have to pay; it’s free!

18743.text: /Why do you spend money on what cannot nourish you/_and your wages on what does not satisfy you?/_Listen carefully to me:/_Eat what is good, and enjoy the best foods.

18744.text: /Open your ears, and come to me!/_Listen so that you may live!/_I will make an everlasting promise to you—/_the blessings I promised to David.

18745.text: /I made him a witness to people,/_a leader and a commander for people.

18746.text: /You will summon a nation that you don’t know,/_and a nation that doesn’t know you will run to you/_because of Yahweh your Elohim,/_because of Qedosh Yisrael./_He has honored you.”

18747.text: ¶Seek Yahweh while he may be found./_Call on him while he is near.

18748.text: /Let wicked people abandon their ways./_Let evil people abandon their thoughts./_Let them return to Yahweh,/_and he will show compassion to them./_Let them return to our Elohim,/_because he will freely forgive them.

18749.text: ¶“My thoughts are not your thoughts,/_and my ways are not your ways,” declares Yahweh.

18750.text: /“Just as the heavens are higher than the earth,/_so my ways are higher than your ways,/_and my thoughts are higher than your thoughts.”

18751.text: ¶“Rain and snow come down from the sky./_They do not go back again until they water the earth./_They make it sprout and grow/_so that it produces seed for farmers/_and food for people to eat.

18752.text: /My word, which comes from my mouth, is like the rain and snow./_It will not come back to me without results./_It will accomplish whatever I want/_and achieve whatever I send it to do.”

18753.text: ¶You will go out with joy and be led out in peace./_The mountains and the hills/_will break into songs of joy in your presence,/_and all the trees will clap their hands.

18754.text: /Cypress trees will grow where thornbushes grew./_Myrtle trees will grow where briars grew./_This will be a reminder of Yahweh’s name/_and an everlasting sign that will never be destroyed.

18755.text: §¶This is what Yahweh says:¶▼Preserve justice, and do what is right./_My salvation is about to come./_My righteousness is about to be revealed.

18756.text: ¶Blessed is the one who does these things/_and the person who holds on to them./_Blessed is the one who keeps the day of worship from becoming unholy/_and his hands from doing anything wrong.

18757.text: ¶Foreigners who have joined Yahweh should not say, “Yahweh will separate us from his people.” Castrated men should not say, “We’re only dead trees!”

18758.text: This is what Yahweh says: I will remember the castrated men who keep my days of worship, choose what pleases me, and faithfully observe the conditions of my promise.

18759.text: Inside my house and within my walls, I will give them something better than sons and daughters. I will give them a monument and a name. I will give them a permanent name that will not be forgotten.

18760.text: And I will remember the foreigners who have joined Yahweh to worship him, to love Yahweh’s name, and to be his servants. All of them will keep the day of worship from becoming unholy and will faithfully observe the conditions of my promise.

18761.text: Then I will bring them to my holy mountain and make them happy in my house of prayer. Their burnt offerings and their sacrifices will be acceptable on my altar, because my house will be called a house of prayer for all nations.

18762.text: ¶Adonay Yahweh, who gathers the scattered people of Israel, declares, “I will gather still others besides those I have already gathered.”

18763.text: §¶All you animals in the field,/_all you animals in the forest,/_come and eat.

18764.text: /Israel’s watchmen are blind./_None of them know anything./_All of them are like dogs that are unable to bark./_They lie around dreaming; they love to sleep.

18765.text: /These dogs have huge appetites./_They are never full./_They are the shepherds,/_but they don’t understand./_All of them have turned to go their own ways./_Each one seeks his own gain.

18766.text: /Each one cries,/_“Let me get some wine,/_and we’ll fill ourselves with liquor./_And tomorrow will be like today, only better.”

18767.text: ¶Righteous people die,/_and no one cares./_Loyal people are taken away,/_and no one understands./_Righteous people are spared when evil comes.

18768.text: /When peace comes,/_everyone who has lived honestly will rest on his own bed.

18769.text: §¶But you—come here,/_you children of witches,/_you descendants of adulterers and prostitutes!

18770.text: /Whom are you making fun of?/_Whom are you making a face at?/_Whom are you sticking out your tongue at?/_Aren’t you rebellious children,/_descendants of liars?

18771.text: /You burn with lust under oak trees/_and under every large tree./_You slaughter children in the valleys/_and under the cracks in the rocks.

18772.text: /Your idols are among the smooth stones in the ravine./_They are your destiny./_You have given them wine offerings/_and sacrificed grain offerings to them./_Do you think I am pleased with all this?

18773.text: ¶You’ve made your bed on a high and lofty mountain./_You’ve gone to offer sacrifices there.

18774.text: /You’ve set up your idols beside doors and doorposts./_You’ve uncovered yourself to the idols./_You’ve distanced yourself from me./_You’ve made your bed with them./_You’ve made a deal with those you have pleasure with in bed./_You’ve seen them naked.

18775.text: /You’ve journeyed to the king with perfumed oils/_and put on plenty of perfume./_You’ve sent your ambassadors far away/_and sent them down to Sheol.

18776.text: /You’ve tired yourself out with many journeys./_You didn’t think that it was hopeless./_You’ve found renewed strength,/_so you didn’t faint.

18777.text: ¶Whom did you dread and fear so much that you lied to me?/_You haven’t remembered me or cared about me./_I’ve been silent for a long time./_Is that why you don’t fear me?

18778.text: /I’ll tell you about your righteous ways and what you have done,/_but they won’t help you.

18779.text: /When you cry for help,/_let your collection of idols save you./_A wind will carry them all away./_A breath will take them away./_But whoever trusts me will possess the land/_and inherit my holy mountain.

18780.text: ¶It will be said:/_“Build a road! Build a road!/_Prepare the way!/_Remove every obstacle in the way of my people!”

18781.text: ¶The High and Lofty One lives forever, and his name is holy.¶►This is what he says:¶▼I live in a high and holy place./_But I am with those who are crushed and humble./_I will renew the spirit of those who are humble/_and the courage of those who are crushed.

18782.text: /I will not accuse you forever./_I will not be angry with you forever./_Otherwise, the spirits, the lives of those I’ve made,/_would grow faint in my presence.

18783.text: /I was angry because of their sinful greed,/_so I punished them, hid from them, and remained angry./_But they continued to be sinful.

18784.text: /I’ve seen their sinful ways, but I’ll heal them./_I’ll guide them and give them rest./_I’ll comfort them and their mourners.

18785.text: /I’ll create praise on their lips:/_“Perfect peace to those both far and near.”/_“I’ll heal them,” says Yahweh.

18786.text: /But the wicked are like the churning sea./_It isn’t quiet,/_and its water throws up mud and slime.

18787.text: ¶“There is no peace for the wicked,” says my Elohim.

18788.text: §¶Cry aloud! Don’t hold back!/_Raise your voice like a ram’s horn./_Tell my people about their rebellion/_and the descendants of Jacob about their sins.

18789.text: /They look for me every day and want to know my ways./_They act as if they were a nation that has done what is right/_and as if they haven’t disregarded Elohim’s judgment on them./_They ask me for just decrees./_They want Elohim to be near them.

18790.text: ¶Why have we fasted if you are not aware of it?/_Why have we inflicted pain on ourselves if you don’t pay attention?¶Don’t you see that on the days you fast,/_you do what you want to do?/_You mistreat all your workers.

18791.text: /Don’t you see that when you fast,/_you quarrel and fight and beat your workers?/_The way you fast today keeps you from being heard in heaven.

18792.text: /Is this the kind of fasting I have chosen?/_Should people humble themselves for only a day?/_Is fasting just bowing your head like a cattail/_and making your bed from sackcloth and ashes?/_Is this what you call fasting?/_Is this an acceptable day to Yahweh?

18793.text: ¶This is the kind of fasting I have chosen:/_Loosen the chains of wickedness,/_untie the straps of the yoke,/_let the oppressed go free,/_and break every yoke.

18794.text: /Share your food with the hungry,/_take the poor and homeless into your house,/_and cover them with clothes when you see them naked./_Don’t refuse to help your relatives.

18795.text: ¶Then your light will break through like the dawn,/_and you will heal quickly./_Your righteousness will go ahead of you,/_and the glory of Yahweh will guard you from behind.

18796.text: /Then you will call, and Yahweh will answer./_You will cry for help, and he will say, “Here I am!”¶Get rid of that yoke./_Don’t point your finger and say wicked things.

18797.text: ¶If you give some of your own food to feed those who are hungry/_and to satisfy the needs of those who are humble,/_then your light will rise in the dark,/_and your darkness will become as bright as the noonday sun.

18798.text: /Yahweh will continually guide you/_and satisfy you even in sun-baked places./_He will strengthen your bones./_You will become like a watered garden/_and like a spring whose water does not stop flowing.

18799.text: /Your people will rebuild the ancient ruins/_and restore the foundations of past generations./_You will be called the Rebuilder of Broken Walls/_and the Restorer of Streets Where People Live.

18800.text: ¶If you stop trampling on the day of worship/_and doing as you please on my holy day,/_if you call the day of worship a delight/_and Yahweh’s holy day honorable,/_if you honor it by not going your own way,/_by not going out when you want, and by not talking idly,

18801.text: /then you will find joy in Yahweh./_I will make you ride on the heights of the earth./_I will feed you with the inheritance of your ancestor Jacob./_Yahweh has spoken.

18802.text: §¶Yahweh is not too weak to save/_or his ear too deaf to hear.

18803.text: /But your wrongs have separated you from your Elohim,/_and your sins have made him hide his face/_so that he doesn’t hear you.

18804.text: /Your hands are stained with blood,/_and your fingers are stained with sin./_You speak lies,/_and you mutter wicked things.

18805.text: /No one calls for justice,/_and no one pleads his case truthfully./_People trust pointless arguments and speak lies./_They conceive trouble and give birth to evil.

18806.text: /They hatch viper eggs/_and weave spiderwebs./_Those who eat their eggs will die./_When an egg is crushed, a poisonous snake is hatched.

18807.text: /Their webs can’t be used for clothes,/_nor can they cover themselves with their works./_Their works are evil./_Their hands have committed acts of violence.

18808.text: /Their feet run to do evil./_They hurry to shed innocent blood./_Their plans are evil./_Ruin and destruction are on their highways.

18809.text: /They don’t know the way of peace./_There’s no justice on their highways./_They’ve made their paths crooked./_Whoever walks on them will never know peace.

18810.text: ¶That is why justice is far from us,/_and righteousness doesn’t reach us./_We hope for light, but we walk in darkness./_We hope for brightness, but we walk in gloom.

18811.text: /We grope like blind men along a wall./_We grope like people without eyes./_We stumble at noon as if it were twilight./_We are like dead people among healthy people.

18812.text: /We all growl like bears./_We coo like doves./_We hope for justice, but there is none./_We hope for salvation, but it’s far from us.

18813.text: ¶You are aware of our many rebellious acts./_Our sins testify against us./_Our rebellious acts are with us./_We know our wrongdoings.

18814.text: /We have rebelled and denied Yahweh./_We have turned away from our Elohim./_We have spoken about oppression and revolt./_We have conceived and uttered lies in our hearts.

18815.text: /Justice is turned back,/_and righteousness stands far away./_Truth has fallen in the street,/_and honesty can’t come in.

18816.text: /Truth is missing./_Those who turn away from evil make themselves victims.¶Yahweh sees it, and he’s angry/_because there’s no justice.

18817.text: /He sees that there’s no one to help./_He’s astounded that there’s no one to intercede./_So with his own power he wins a victory./_His righteousness supports him.

18818.text: /He puts on righteousness like a coat of armor/_and a helmet of salvation on his head./_He wears clothes of vengeance./_He wraps himself with fury as a coat.

18819.text: /He will pay them back according to their deeds./_He will pay back his opponents with wrath and punish his enemies./_He will pay back the people who live on the coastlands.

18820.text: /The people of the west will fear the name of Yahweh./_Those in the east will fear his glory./_He will come like a rushing stream./_The wind of Yahweh pushes him.

18821.text: ¶“Then a Go’el will come to Zion,/_to those in Jacob who turn from rebellion,” declares Yahweh.

18822.text: ¶“This is my promise to them,” says Yahweh. “My Ruach, who is on you, and my words that I put in your mouth will not leave you. They will be with your children and your grandchildren permanently,” says Yahweh.

18823.text: §¶Arise! Shine! Your light has come,/_and the glory of Yahweh has dawned.

18824.text: /Darkness now covers the earth,/_and thick darkness covers the nations./_But Yahweh dawns,/_and his glory appears over you.

18825.text: /Nations will come to your light,/_and kings will come to the brightness of your dawn.

18826.text: ¶“Look up, look around, and watch./_All of your people assemble and come to you./_Your sons come from far away./_Your daughters are carried in their arms.

18827.text: /Then you will see this and rejoice,/_and your heart will be thrilled with joy,/_because the riches of the sea will be brought to you./_The wealth of the nations will come to you.

18828.text: ¶“Many camels will cover your land,/_young camels from Midian and Ephah./_Everyone from Sheba will come./_They will bring gold and incense./_They will sing the praises of Yahweh.

18829.text: /All of the flocks from Kedar will gather and come to you./_The rams of Nebaioth will serve you./_They will be sacrificed as acceptable offerings on my altar./_So I will honor my beautiful temple.

18830.text: ¶“Who are these people that fly by like clouds,/_like doves to their nests?

18831.text: /Certainly, the coastlands wait with hope for me./_The ships from Tarshish are the first to bring your children/_from far away./_Their silver and their gold comes with them/_to honor the name of Yahweh your Elohim, Qedosh Yisrael,/_because he has honored you.

18832.text: ¶“Foreigners will rebuild your walls,/_and their kings will serve you./_In my anger I struck you,/_but in my favor I have compassion on you.

18833.text: /Your gates will always be open./_They will never be closed day or night/_so that people may bring you the wealth of nations,/_with their kings led as prisoners.

18834.text: /Nations and kingdoms that do not serve you will be destroyed./_The nations will certainly be ruined.

18835.text: ¶“Lebanon’s glory will come to you:/_Cedar, fir, and cypress trees will come to beautify my holy place,/_and I will honor the place where my feet rest.

18836.text: /The descendants of those who oppress you will bow in front of you./_All who despise you will bow at your feet./_They will call you the city of Yahweh,/_Zion, the city of Qedosh Yisrael.

18837.text: ¶“You have been abandoned and hated; no one has passed through you./_But now I will make you a source of everlasting pride,/_a joy for all generations.

18838.text: /You will drink milk from other nations/_and nurse at royal breasts./_Then you will know that I am Yahweh, your Savior,/_the Mighty One of Jacob, your Go’el.

18839.text: /I will bring gold instead of bronze./_I will bring silver instead of iron,/_bronze instead of wood, and iron instead of stone./_I will appoint peace as your governor and righteousness as your ruler.

18840.text: /No longer will you hear about violence in your land/_or desolation and destruction within your borders./_You will call your walls Salvation and your gates Praise.

18841.text: /The sun will no longer be your light during the day,/_nor will the brightness of the moon give you light,/_But Yahweh will be your everlasting light./_Your Elohim will be your glory.

18842.text: /Your sun will no longer go down,/_nor will your moon disappear./_Yahweh will be your everlasting light,/_and your days of sadness will be over.

18843.text: /Then all your people will be righteous,/_and they will possess the land permanently./_They will be the seedling I have planted,/_the honored work of my hands.

18844.text: /The smallest of them will become a family./_The weakest of them will become a mighty nation./_At the right time I, Yahweh, will make it happen quickly.”

18845.text: §¶The Ruach of Adonay Yahweh is with me/_because Yahweh has anointed me/_to deliver good news to humble people./_He has sent me/_to heal those who are brokenhearted,/_to announce that captives will be set free/_and prisoners will be released.

18846.text: /He has sent me/_to announce the year of Yahweh’s good will/_and the day of our Elohim’s vengeance,/_to comfort all those who grieve.

18847.text: /He has sent me/_to provide for all those who grieve in Zion,/_to give them crowns instead of ashes,/_the oil of joy instead of tears of grief,/_and clothes of praise instead of a spirit of weakness.¶They will be called Oaks of Righteousness,/_the Plantings of Yahweh,/_so that he might display his glory.

18848.text: ¶They will rebuild the ancient ruins./_They will restore the places destroyed long ago./_They will renew the ruined cities, the places destroyed generations ago.

18849.text: /Foreigners will come forward and become shepherds for your flocks,/_and children of foreigners will work your fields and vineyards.

18850.text: /You will be called the priests of Yahweh./_You will be called the servants of our Elohim./_You will consume the wealth of the nations./_You will boast in their splendor.

18851.text: /You will receive a double measure of wealth instead of your shame./_You will sing about your wealth instead of being disgraced./_That is why you will have a double measure of wealth in your land./_You will have everlasting joy.

18852.text: /I, Yahweh, love justice./_I hate robbery and wrongdoing./_I will faithfully reward my people’s work./_I will make an everlasting promise to them.

18853.text: /Then their offspring will be known among the nations/_and their descendants among the people./_Everyone who sees them will recognize/_that they are the descendants whom Yahweh has blessed.

18854.text: ¶I will find joy in Yahweh./_I will delight in my Elohim./_He has dressed me in the clothes of salvation./_He has wrapped me in the robe of righteousness/_like a bridegroom with a priest’s turban,/_like a bride with her jewels.

18855.text: /Like the ground that brings forth its crops/_and like a garden that makes the seed in it grow,/_so Adonay Yahweh will make righteousness and praise/_spring up in front of all nations.

18856.text: §¶For Zion’s sake I will not remain silent./_For Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest,/_until its righteousness shines like the dawn/_and its salvation burns brightly like a torch.

18857.text: /The nations will see your righteousness./_All kings will see your glory./_You will be given a new name/_that Yahweh will announce.

18858.text: /Then you will be a beautiful crown in the hand of Yahweh,/_a royal crown in the hand of your Elohim.

18859.text: /You will no longer be called Deserted,/_and your land will no longer be called Destroyed./_But you will be named My Delight,/_and your land will be named Married./_Yahweh is delighted with you,/_and your land will be married.

18860.text: /As a young man marries a woman,/_so your sons will marry you./_As a bridegroom rejoices over his bride,/_so your Elohim will rejoice over you.

18861.text: ¶I have posted watchmen on your walls, Jerusalem./_They will never be silent day or night./_Whoever calls on Yahweh, do not give yourselves any rest,

18862.text: /and do not give him any rest until he establishes Jerusalem/_and makes it an object of praise throughout the earth.

18863.text: /Yahweh has sworn with his right hand and with his mighty arm,/_“I will never again let your enemies eat your grain,/_nor will foreigners drink the new wine which you made.”

18864.text: /_Those who harvest grain/_will eat it and praise Yahweh./_Those who gather grapes/_will drink wine in my holy courtyards.

18865.text: ¶Go through! Go through the gates!/_Prepare a way for the people!/_Build up! Build up the highway!/_Clear away the stones!/_Raise a flag for the people!

18866.text: ¶Yahweh has announced to the ends of the earth:/_“Tell my people Zion,/_‘Your Savior is coming./_His reward is with him,/_and the people he has won arrive ahead of him.’”

18867.text: ¶They will be called Holy People, Those Reclaimed by Yahweh,/_and you will be called Sought After, a City Not Deserted.

18868.text: §¶Who is this coming from Bozrah in Edom/_with his clothes stained bright red?/_Who is this dressed in splendor,/_going forward with great strength?¶“It is I, Yahweh. I am coming to announce my victory./_I am powerful enough to save you.”

18869.text: ¶Why are your clothes red/_and your garments like those who trample grapes in a winepress?

18870.text: ¶“I have trampled alone in the winepress./_No one was with me./_In my anger I trampled on people./_In my wrath I stomped on them./_Their blood splattered my clothes/_so all my clothing has been stained.

18871.text: /I planned the day of vengeance./_The year for my reclaiming you has come.

18872.text: /I looked, but there was no help./_I was astounded that there was no outside support./_So with my own power I won a victory./_My anger supported me.

18873.text: /_In my anger I trampled on people./_In my wrath I made them drunk/_and poured their blood on the ground.”

18874.text: §¶I will acknowledge Yahweh’s acts of mercy,/_and sing the praises of Yahweh,/_because of everything that Yahweh has done for us./_He has done many good things for the nation of Israel/_because of his compassion and his unlimited mercy.

18875.text: /He said, “They are my people,/_children who will not lie to me.”/_So he became their Savior.

18876.text: /In all their troubles he was troubled,/_and he was the Messenger who saved them./_In his love and compassion he reclaimed them./_He always held them and carried them in the past.

18877.text: /But they rebelled and offended his Ruach Qodesh./_So he turned against them as their enemy; he fought against them.

18878.text: ¶Then his people remembered Moses and the distant past./_Where is the one who brought them out of the sea/_with the shepherds of his flock?/_Where is the one who put his Ruach Qodesh in them?

18879.text: /Where is the one who sent his powerful arm/_to support the right hand of Moses?/_Where is the one who divided the water in front of them/_to make an everlasting name for himself?

18880.text: /Where is the one who led them through the deep water?/_Like horses in the wilderness,/_they didn’t stumble.

18881.text: /Like animals going down into a valley,/_they were given rest by Ruach Yahweh./_In this way you guided your people/_to make an honored name for yourself.

18882.text: ¶Look down and see from heaven, from your holy and beautiful dwelling./_Where is your determination and might?/_Where is the longing of your heart and your compassion?/_Don’t hold back.

18883.text: /You are our Ab./_Even though Abraham doesn’t know us/_and Israel doesn’t pay attention to us,/_O Yahweh, you are our Ab./_Your name is our Go’el From Everlasting.

18884.text: /O Yahweh, why do you let us wander from your ways/_and become so stubborn that we are unable to fear you?/_Return for the sake of your servants./_They are the tribes that belong to you.

18885.text: ¶Your holy people possessed the land for a little while./_Our enemies have trampled on your holy place.

18886.text: /We have become like those whom you never ruled,/_like those who are not called by your name.

18887.text: ¶If only you would split open the heavens and come down!/_The mountains would quake at your presence.

18888.text: /_Be like the fire that kindles brushwood and makes water boil./_Come down to make your name known to your enemies./_The nations will tremble in your presence.

18889.text: /When you did awe-inspiring things that we didn’t expect,/_you came down and the mountains quaked in your presence.

18890.text: /No one has ever heard,/_no one has paid attention,/_and no one has seen any god except you./_You help those who wait for you.

18891.text: ¶You greeted the one who gladly does right and remembers your ways./_You showed your anger, because we’ve sinned./_We’ve continued to sin for a long time./_Can we still be saved?

18892.text: /We’ve all become unclean,/_and all our righteous acts are like permanently stained rags./_All of us shrivel like leaves,/_and our sins carry us away like the wind.

18893.text: /No one calls on your name/_or tries to hold on to you./_You have hidden your face from us./_You have let us be ruined by our sins.

18894.text: ¶But now, Yahweh, you are our Ab./_We are the clay, and you are our potter./_We are the work of your hands.

18895.text: /Don’t be too angry, Yahweh./_Don’t remember our sin forever./_Now look, we are all your people.

18896.text: /Your holy cities have become a desert./_Zion has become a desert./_Jerusalem is a wasteland.

18897.text: /Our holy and beautiful temple, where our ancestors praised you,/_has been burned to the ground./_All that we valued has been ruined.

18898.text: /Despite these things, Yahweh, will you hold back?/_Will you be silent and make us suffer more than we can bear?

18899.text: §¶I was ready to answer those who didn’t ask./_I was found by those who weren’t looking for me./_I said, “Here I am! Here I am!”/_to a nation that didn’t worship me.

18900.text: /I stretched out my hands all day long to stubborn people./_They chose to go the wrong direction./_They followed their own plans.

18901.text: /These people constantly and openly provoked me./_They offered sacrifices in gardens/_and burnt incense on brick altars.

18902.text: /They sat among the graves and spent their nights in caves./_They ate pork and in their pots made broth from unclean foods.

18903.text: /They said, “Stay away! Don’t touch me!/_I’m holier than you are.”/_They have become like smoke in my nose,/_like a smoldering fire all day long.

18904.text: ¶“Look! It is written in front of me.¶▼I will not be silent, but I will repay./_I will repay you in full.

18905.text: /I will repay you for your sins/_and for the sins of your ancestors,” says Yahweh./_They burnt incense on the mountains and slandered me on the hills,/_so I will be the first to pay them back in full.

18906.text: ¶This is what Yahweh says:¶▼When someone finds juice for new wine in a cluster of grapes,/_another person will say,/_“Don’t destroy it, because there’s a blessing in it.”/_In the same way, I will do this for my servants:/_I will not destroy everything.

18907.text: /I will bring with me Jacob’s descendant,/_one who will inherit my mountains from Judah./_My chosen ones will inherit them./_My servants will live there.

18908.text: /The Sharon Plain will be a pasture for flocks./_The Achor Valley will be a resting place for cattle/_and for my people who search for me.

18909.text: /You have abandoned Yahweh/_and forgotten my holy mountain./_You have prepared a table for the god of good fortune/_and offered cups full of spiced wine to the goddess of destiny.

18910.text: /Now I will destine you for death./_All of you will bow to be slaughtered./_I called, but you didn’t answer./_I spoke, but you didn’t listen./_You did what I consider evil./_You chose what I don’t like.

18911.text: ¶This is what Adonay Yahweh says:¶▼My servants will eat, but you will be hungry./_My servants will drink, but you will be thirsty./_My servants will be glad, but you will be ashamed.

18912.text: /My servants will sing because of the gladness in their hearts./_But you will cry because of your sadness/_and wail because of your depression.

18913.text: /Your name will be used as a curse by my chosen ones./_Adonay Yahweh will kill you/_and call his servants by another name.

18914.text: /Whoever asks for a blessing in the land/_will be blessed by the God of Truth./_Whoever swears an oath in the land/_will swear by the God of Truth./_Past troubles are forgotten./_They are hidden from my eyes.

18915.text: ¶I will create a new heaven and a new earth./_Past things will not be remembered./_They will not come to mind.

18916.text: /Be glad, and rejoice forever in what I’m going to create,/_because I’m going to create Jerusalem to be a delight/_and its people to be a joy.

18917.text: /I will rejoice about Jerusalem and be glad about my people./_Screaming and crying will no longer be heard in the city.

18918.text: /There will no longer be an infant who lives for only a few days/_or an old man who doesn’t live a long life./_Whoever lives to be a hundred years old will be thought of as young./_Whoever dies before he is a hundred years old will be cursed as a sinner.

18919.text: /They will build houses and live there./_They will plant vineyards and eat fruit from them.

18920.text: /They will not build homes and have others live there./_They will not plant and have others eat from it./_My people will live as long as trees,/_and my chosen ones will enjoy what they’ve done.

18921.text: /They will never again work for nothing./_They will never again give birth to children who die young,/_because they will be offspring blessed by Yahweh./_The Lord will bless their descendants as well.

18922.text: /Before they call, I will answer./_While they’re still speaking, I will hear.

18923.text: /Wolves and lambs will feed together,/_lions will eat straw like oxen,/_and dust will be food for snakes./_“They will not hurt or destroy anyone anywhere on my holy mountain,”/_says Yahweh.

18924.text: §¶This is what Yahweh says:¶▼Heaven is my throne./_The earth is my footstool./_Where can you build a house or resting place for me?

18925.text: /I have made all these things./_“That is why all these things have come into being,”/_declares Yahweh./_I will pay attention to those/_who are humble and sorry for their sins/_and who tremble at my word.

18926.text: ¶Whoever kills a bull is like someone who kills a person./_Whoever sacrifices a lamb is like someone who breaks a dog’s neck./_Whoever offers a grain sacrifice/_is like someone who offers pig’s blood./_Whoever burns incense is like someone who worships an idol./_People have certainly chosen their own ways,/_and their souls delight in detestable things.

18927.text: ¶So I will choose harsh treatment for them/_and bring on them what they fear./_I called, but no one answered./_I spoke, but they didn’t listen./_They did what I consider evil./_They chose what I don’t like.

18928.text: ¶Listen to the word of Yahweh, all who tremble at his word.¶▼Your relatives, who hate you and exclude you for my name’s sake, say,/_“Let Yahweh show his glory; then we will see your joy.”/_But they will be put to shame.

18929.text: /Listen to the uproar from the city./_Listen to the sound from the temple./_It is the sound of Yahweh/_paying back his enemies as they deserve.

18930.text: ¶Before a woman goes into labor, she gives birth./_Before she has labor pains, she delivers a child.

18931.text: /Who has heard of such a thing?/_Who has seen such things?/_Can a country be born in one day?/_Can a nation be born in a moment?/_When Zion went into labor,/_she also gave birth to her children.

18932.text: /“Do I bring a mother to the moment of birth/_and not let her deliver?” asks Yahweh./_“Do I cause a mother to deliver/_and then make her unable to have children?” asks your Elohim.

18933.text: /All who love Jerusalem, be happy and rejoice with her./_All who mourn for her, be glad with her.

18934.text: /You will nurse and be satisfied from her comforting breasts./_You will nurse to your heart’s delight at her full breasts.

18935.text: ¶This is what Yahweh says:¶▼I will offer you peace like a river/_and the wealth of the nations like an overflowing stream./_You will nurse and be carried in Jerusalem’s arms/_and cuddled on her knees.

18936.text: /As a mother comforts her child,/_so will I comfort you./_You will be comforted in Jerusalem.

18937.text: /When you see it, your heart will rejoice/_and you will flourish like new grass./_The power of Yahweh will be made known to his servants,/_but he will condemn his enemies.

18938.text: /Yahweh will come with fire/_and with his chariots like a thunderstorm./_He will pay them back with his burning anger/_and punish them with flames of fire.

18939.text: /Yahweh will judge with fire,/_and he will judge all people with his sword./_Many people will be struck dead by Yahweh.

18940.text: ¶People make themselves holy/_and prepare themselves for their garden rituals./_They go into the garden/_and devour pork, disgusting things, and mice./_“They will come to an end at the same time,”/_declares Yahweh.

18941.text: /Because of their actions and their thoughts,/_I am coming to gather the nations of every language./_They will come and see my glory.

18942.text: /I will set up a sign among them/_and send some of their survivors to the nations:/_to Tarshish, Put and Lud, Meshech, Rosh, Tubal, Javan,/_and to the distant coastlands/_who have not heard of my fame or seen my glory./_They will tell about my glory among the nations.

18943.text: /They will bring all your relatives/_from every nation like a grain offering to Yahweh./_“They will come on horses, in chariots, in wagons,/_on mules and camels to my holy mountain, Jerusalem,”/_declares Yahweh./_They will come like the people of Israel who bring/_their grain offerings in clean dishes to Yahweh’s temple.

18944.text: /“I will make some of them priests and Levites,” declares Yahweh.

18945.text: /“The new heaven and earth that I am about to make/_will continue in my presence,” declares Yahweh./_“So your descendants and your name/_will also continue in my presence.

18946.text: /From one month to the next and from one week to the next/_all people will come to worship me,” declares Yahweh.

18947.text: /Then they will go out/_and look at the corpses of those who have rebelled against me./_The worms that eat them will not die./_The fire that burns them will not go out./_All humanity will be disgusted by them.
